Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
About us

Founded in 2015, Instabox is a Sweden-based tech company with the mission to make online shopping easier. In 2022, Instabee was founded after combining Budbee and Instabox - two leading last-mile delivery companies with three consumer-facing brands: Budbee, Instabox, and Porterbuddy. Instabee serves millions of consumers across Europe with convenient deliveries and is on track to become the leading European e-commerce enabler. Always with the merchant at heart.

We’re fast, both in terms of parcel delivery and when it comes to growing our business. So far our journey has taken us from Sweden to the rest of Scandinavia and parts of continental Europe, but we have no plans on stopping anytime soon. As we continue to expand, the complexity of Instabee grows in parallel. With that in mind, we’re now looking for a Software Engineer with machine learning knowledge to help us govern our journey ahead!

About the role

At the Route Optimization team, you’ll play a crucial role in building, maintaining, and enhancing the models and services that drive our core operations. We follow an end-to-end approach: collecting and preprocessing data, developing and validating models, deploying these models, and integrating them into our routing engine. Your work will directly impact how Instabee optimizes its routes, empowering the business to make informed strategic decisions, improve operational efficiency, and enhance customer satisfaction.

To do this we’ll expect you to:

Build and maintain models and services and deploy them

Take the lead on developing new features and refactoring existing code, ensuring high standards of code quality and efficiency

Stay at the forefront of software development trends, experimenting with new approaches and technologies to continuously improve our systems

Work closely with algorithm engineers, machine learning engineers, and the broader tech team to share ideas and support each other in achieving our goals

Advocate for best coding practices, both within the team and across the organization, inspiring others to maintain high standards




To succeed in this role you probably:

Love writing high-quality production-grade code

Have 3+ years of experience as a Software Engineer or Machine Learning Engineer, working in a modern tech environment

Experience in building and deploying machine learning models

Strong programming skills in Python and Java. Experience with various databases is a plus

Familiarity with Kubernetes, Helm, Docker, and other DevOps tools

You’ve led feature development, refactoring efforts, and know how to inspire those around you

If this is you, we really can’t wait to meet you!



What you’ll get

We can promise you that you will be challenged, develop your skills and have the opportunity to work with truly amazing and competent colleagues. If you like changes and want to set new processes and ways of working - this is the place for you!

Of course, we have all the necessary and standard benefits in place, but in addition to this, we can also offer:

🌇 Sky-High Office: Modern and newly renovated with a 360-degree view around Stockholm.
🐶 Puppy Friendly: Bring your dog to work - we've got a whole floor for our furry friends!
🍸 Rooftop Fridays: Chill out at our Friday rooftop bar with the best views in town
🥐 Wednesdays Tech Breakfasts: Fuel your midweek with tech talks and tasty bites.
👾 Tech Demos: Dive into the latest innovations with our regular tech showcases.
💻 Modern Tech Stack: Work with cutting-edge technology every day.
🏓 Fun & Games: Ping pong, Shuffleboard, Foosball, and even a Karaoke Room for your leisure time.
⏰ Flexible Hours: Hybrid setup with working hours that adapt to your lifestyle.
👶 Parental Pay for Six Months: Step away from work and provide the best care
and love to your little one.
🎂 A Day Off on Your Birthday: We love to celebrate, so enjoy your birthday to the fullest with a day off each year!


Diversity and inclusion is very important to us and we are committed to creating an inclusive work environment. We want to be a workplace where everyone’s perspectives and opinions are valued, and we are dedicated to creating opportunities for all employees to thrive and reach their full potential.

This recruitment process consists of background checks via Verifiera as a review of previous public criminal records. The result is public information that is handled confidentially. This is mandatory for all recruitment processes at Instabee (Instabox/Budbee) in Sweden.

Title: Machine Learning Engineering Associate
Description:
We are looking for an innovative and passionate Machine Learning Engineer Associate to join our fast-paced, dynamic team. As a key member of our technology division, you will play a vital role in developing, deploying, and optimizing end-to-end machine learning models. This role demands expertise in MLOps (Machine Learning Operations), Data Science, Data Analisys and the ability to handle the entire machine learning lifecycle—from data ingestion to model deployment and beyond.

As a Machine Learning Engineer at Oppizi, you will have the opportunity to collaborate with cross-functional teams, including software engineers and product managers, to deliver high-quality ML solutions that directly impact business outcomes. You will also be responsible for ensuring that our models are scalable, efficient, and aligned with the company's goals.

Key Responsibilities:


Model Development and Deployment: Design, implement, and deploy machine learning models that address business needs, ensuring high availability and performance in production environments
MLOps and Automation: Apply MLOps best practices to automate the ML lifecycle, including data ingestion, training, and deployment pipelines. Build and maintain CI/CD pipelines for continuous integration and delivery
Performance Monitoring and Optimization: Monitor deployed models to ensure they meet performance metrics, and continuously improve them for accuracy and scalability
Collaboration and Communication: Work closely with software engineers, product managers, and other stakeholders to develop and communicate ML solutions effectively



Requirements

What are you bringing to the team:


Education: Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Machine Learning, or a related field
Experience: Minimum of 2 years of experience as a Machine Learning Engineer, Data Scientist or in a similar role
MLOps Expertise: Proven experience with MLOps tools and frameworks (e.g., MLflow, Kubeflow, TensorFlow Extended)
Programming Skills: Strong proficiency in Python and experience with libraries such as Pandas, NumPy, and Scikit-learn
Cloud & Containerization: Hands-on experience with cloud platforms like AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud, and familiarity with containerization technologies like Docker and Kubernetes
Data & API Proficiency: Experience with data manipulation and building APIs using frameworks such as FastAPI, Flask, or Django
Communication Skills: Ability to explain complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders


Nice to have:


Experience with big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark)
Familiarity with deep learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch)
Knowledge of DevOps practices and tools



Benefits

Salary range: 40k-50k USD with performance-based bonuses.

Stock option program

Professional growth opportunities in a fast-growing startup.

Flexible working hours and remote work options.
Show more

Title: Specialist, AI & Data Science
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We are looking for a highly skilled and passionate Specialist with solid technical experience within the field of AI and Data Science. More specifically, we are looking for a Specialist to join our AI tribe in our office in Copenhagen.

Are you our new Specialist?

As a Specialist within AI and Data Science at Intellishore, you will get the opportunity to be innovative, create lasting impacts for a wide range of customers, and excel in a culture of collaboration.

We are seeking a Specialist with substantial experience in analytics, data engineering, and AI to drive large, technical data science and AI projects and lead technical teams and/or initiatives. You will get to shape and implement technology as well as business solutions to deliver value to our clients across different industries, business areas and technologies. Two projects are rarely the same!

Who is Intellishore?

Intellishore is an advanced analytics, AI, and strategy consultancy founded in 2013 with the idea of providing clients with a seamless combination of strategic and technical expertise. Today, we are more than 70 skilled, entrepreneurial, and passionate employees from many different backgrounds; data engineering, economics, business, marketing, and data science. We deliver solutions across the value chain - no project is the same, and the energy is high.

We are Intellishorians; a unique collective of passionate professionals who have jumped at the chance to be part of a larger journey.

What are we looking for in a Specialist?

We Are Looking For An Experienced Individual With The Competencies And Professional Mindset To Be a Tech Lead Within AI And Data Science. If You Meet The Following Attributes, You Could Be The Person We Are Looking For


4+ years of experience executing projects within analytics, data engineering, and AI.
Hands-on experience in solution architecture and design, including machine learning models, large language models, and data science solutions.
Strong problem-solving skills and ability to translate business objectives into technical requirements.
Excellent communication skills with experience collaborating across technical and non-technical teams.
Experience mentoring and leading technical initiatives is a plus.
It is an advantage if you have experience within the life science industry.



And do not worry about whether you have too much or too little experience. We are always looking for curious and passionate people to join our family, and your title will match your level of seniority and expertise.

What can we offer you?

1 | Challenging projects

Exciting and challenging project Specialist role in strategic & technical advanced data and AI projects.

2 | Entrepreneurial work environment

A highly entrepreneurial work environment with ambitious and innovative colleagues focused on rapidly growing the Intellishore business.

3 | Influence

Unique opportunity for influencing and directing Intellishore’s market position, commercial growth, and strategic journey.

4 | Strategic seminars

A yearly strategic seminar where all Intellishorians across locations spend time strategizing and team-building (in previous years, we've been to South Africa, Japan, India, China, Dubai, Iceland, and Germany). In 2025 we are going to Italy!

5 | Sustainable consulting

A consulting career with high levels of flexibility allowing for work-life balance.

6 | Exciting growth journey

We are on a mission to redefine the world of data & AI, and we are constantly expanding our reach.

Apply now

If you are interested in applying for this position, fill out the application form. We encourage you to attach a short motivational letter. Applicants will be invited to interviews on a rolling basis.

We acknowledge that a change in career path requires careful consideration and that timing is crucial. Therefore, you are always welcome to reach out as you see fit.

For more information about the position, please reach out to Sofie Freund: sofie.freund@intellishore.dk / +45 71 54 01 08.

At the moment, we are only accepting applications from applicants inside Europa.
Show more

Unique opportunity for influencing and directing Intellishore’s market position, commercial growth, and strategic journey.

4 | Strategic seminars

A yearly strategic seminar where all Intellishorians across locations spend time strategizing and team-building (in previous years, we've been to South Africa, Japan, India, China, Dubai, Iceland, and Germany). In 2025 we are going to Italy!

5 | Sustainable consulting

A consulting career with high levels of flexibility allowing for work-life balance.

6 | Exciting growth journey

We are on a mission to redefine the world of data & AI, and we are constantly expanding our reach.

Apply now

If you are interested in applying for this position, fill out the application form. We encourage you to attach a short motivational letter. Applicants will be invited to interviews on a rolling basis.

We acknowledge that a change in career path requires careful consideration and that timing is crucial. Therefore, you are always welcome to reach out as you see fit.

For more information about the position, please reach out to Sofie Freund: sofie.freund@intellishore.dk / +45 71 54 01 08.

At the moment, we are only accepting applications from applicants inside Europa.

Title: Data Scientist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Data Scientist

We are seeking a data scientist to join us on the journey of defining Carlsberg's commercial analytics data science strategy and support the creation of advanced analytics and machine learning models to address intricate business challenges at Carlsberg.

Great beers, great colleagues, a focus on personal development and a diverse and inclusive workplace – we’d like you to come and be part of shaping our future.

This is an exhilarating time to join Carlsberg, as we are currently shaping our strategy for leveraging advanced analytics and generative AI to support our ambitious five-year program. You'll also have the opportunity to contribute to key analytical initiatives, such as our Value Management program.

What You’ll Be Doing

Your tasks will mainly consist of:


Collaborating with business SMEs to identify and address business challenges through analytics.
Designing, creating, testing, and deploying complex algorithms to drive analytical solutions across the organization.
Working with IT and business teams to implement scalable and sustainable analytical solutions.
Establishing standards and guidelines to ensure responsible and scalable AI practices throughout the SDLC.
Managing relationships with vendors and strategic tech partners to ensure visibility into our work and to influence vendor product teams in delivering long-term solutions tailored to our needs.


What We’re Looking For


Between 3-5 years of diverse technical experience in delivering statistical analytics, data science, and insights on large-scale data sets.
Proven track record of leveraging data science and advanced analytics to drive business value and transformation.
Strong expertise in Python (including NumPy and pandas) is essential; familiarity with PySpark, Databricks, and Azure is a plus.
Experience with MLOps tools and DevOps practices is advantageous.
Background in developing models for pricing, promotion, and assortment optimization is desirable.
Ability and enthusiasm for coaching and mentoring less experienced data scientists.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to engage and influence stakeholders at all levels, both internal and external.
Demonstrated experience in planning and managing multiple projects simultaneously.


What You Can Expect

We are a global team who work closely together despite being at a distance and we support each other when needed. We have an informal tone and though we are serious about our work we like to have fun together meeting in “virtual Friday bars”.

We’re geared to work globally and as such the role provides a great opportunity to be flexible; supporting better brewing for tomorrow with work schedules that can support you today.

We encourage you to visit and learn more about our DE&I Strategy: Sustainability » Our ESG programme » Diversity, Equity and Inclusion « Carlsberg Group

If you join our team, some of the benefits you’ll enjoy are:


Flexible, hybrid work model
Annual bonus based on company and individual performance
Unlimited soft and coffee drinks in the office
Monthly beer and soft drink allowance
Well-equipped and comfortable office in the heart of Carlsberg City District in Valby, Copenhagen
Opportunities to have fun together during regular Friday bars
Being part of a company with an enormous heritage and a strong connection with Denmark’s Capital City


About Carlsberg Integrated Information Technology (IIT)

Carlsberg IIT is the global provider of business services to all functions, regions and markets in the Carlsberg Group. This includes business process design, system solutions, shared services and system operations. IIT employs approx. 600 people. A tight collaboration with the local markets is established in all three regions; Western Europe, Eastern Europe and Asia. Carlsberg IIT is situated in Valby, Copenhagen. Carlsberg IIT is overall responsible for the provision of IT and data services across all Carlsberg functions and markets, the words ‘Technology’ and ‘Information’ are given.

The word ‘Integrated’ refers to the fact that the IIT Function will operate in close alignment with the business agenda of functions and regions. Furthermore, ‘Integrated’ hints that services provided by IIT should be a naturally embedded part of our colleague’s work.

Interested?

Apply through the link. Please notice that this is the only way we accept applications.

The deadline for applying is the 24th of February. We read applications continuously, and vacancies may be filled sooner than the deadline, so we encourage you to apply as early as possible.

We look forward to receiving your application.

Carlsberg Group: Brewing for a better today and tomorrow

For us success has always been in the diverse mix of our people, our beers and our brands. At Carlsberg, we want to recruit and develop people with a global mindset, cultural understanding, and international experience to ensure that our organization stays agile, inclusive and prepared for future growth. Only by acknowledging and harvesting from different perspectives and experiences, will we gain competitive advantage and leverage the effect of diversity for business growth. Carlsberg aims to create equal access to opportunity regardless of social identity, and we encourage everyone to apply regardless of gender, nationality, race, religion or any other characteristics protected by law.

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
Job Description

Are you skilled in Machine Learning (ML) and Artificial Intelligence (AI) and experienced with the full ML/AI lifecycle, from training models to deploying them at scale? Do you excel at combining technical expertise with practical solutions to enhance business processes through predictive and prescriptive analytics? If so, you could be our next AI Engineer!

Depending on your experience, we will consider you for either an AI Engineer or Senior AI Engineer role.

What We Offer You

As an AI Engineer at JYSK, you will be part of an agile AI product team driving our strategic ambition to integrate AI across our business processes. You will work alongside skilled professionals, including data scientists, platform engineers, and software developers, to build and scale AI solutions.

Furthermore, we offer you:


A dynamic workplace in an international company focused on growth and development.
A collaborative, open-minded environment with opportunities to engage across all organisational levels.
A flexible work-from-home policy and a strong work-life balance.
Access to staff benefits, discounts within the Lars Larsen Group, and social activities throughout the year.
A range of internal courses and training sessions for personal and professional development.
A welcoming and supportive company culture with a comprehensive onboarding programme.


What Your Next Job Will Be About

As an AI Engineer, you will be instrumental in developing AI solutions that drive innovation, enable data-driven decision-making, improve operations, and enhance customer experiences. You will bridge software engineering and data science, focusing on deploying and integrating AI models to create scalable, efficient, and reusable solutions.

Your tasks and responsibilities in the job include:


Building AI applications using Python and machine learning libraries, leveraging your software engineering expertise.
Collaborating with Data Scientists, Platform Engineers, and ML-Ops specialists to develop impactful AI solutions.
Managing AI workloads on Google Cloud Platform (GCP) to ensure optimal performance and resource efficiency.
Designing scalable AI inference services for seamless integration with existing systems.
Working with architects to refine AI solution design and contributing to solution planning phases.
Supporting end-users of AI solutions with a "you build it, you own it" mindset.


You can read more about our department here.

What Should You Bring

We are looking for a new colleague who:


Has a strong foundation in Software Engineering and expertise in training, optimising, and deploying Machine Learning models for performance and scalability.
Has experience developing, operating, and monitoring AI/ML models at scale, preferably on Google Cloud Platform (or equivalent experience with Azure/AWS and willingness to transition to GCP).
Possesses strong knowledge of AI development methodologies and tools such as Python, ML Flow, and Google Vertex AI.
Works independently on complex tasks, engaging stakeholders as needed to ensure success.
Demonstrates an MVP mindset and actively contributes to building minimum viable products within an agile team.
Is proactive, willing to mentor others, and takes pride in delivering high-quality work.


Additional Information

IS THIS YOUR NEXT OPPORTUNITY? Apply today!

Send us a brief application with your CV by clicking “Apply”. We process applications on an ongoing basis and complete the recruitment once we have found the right candidate.

About Us

We believe that our employees are key to our success going from one store in 1979 to more than 3,400 stores worldwide today. That is why we strive to offer development and possibilities of growing within JYSK, and we also take pride in rewarding engagement and a great effort among our employees. Our three fundamental JYSK Values – Tradesman, Colleague and Corporate Spirit – express the behaviour and attitude that we can expect from each other. We trust each other, and we believe in delegation and freedom with responsibility.

JYSK wants to include everyone, no matter the age, gender identity, race, sexual orientation, physical or mental ability, ethnicity, and experience. Together, we secure our inclusive culture that encourages, supports, and celebrates the diverse voices of our employees. Because a great mix of minds, talents and unique personalities makes us a stronger team.

For more information, please visit our career page.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Peoplement Executive Search on behalf of our client.




About Ferrosan Medical Devices A/S




Ferrosan Medical Devices A/S develops and produces a portfolio of hemostatic products to aid surgery and minimize bleeding challenges (SPONGOSTAN™ and SURGIFLO™). The products are registered as medical devices (Class III). They are sold internationally in over 100 countries in close collaboration with the primary customer and innovation partner, Johnson & Johnson MedTech.

All main functions in the company are in Søborg, DK, including production facilities, so everyone sits door to door with easy access to each other.







The Product Innovation department

Ferrosan Medical Devices is working on several innovation projects to address new surgical needs. These projects explore trends and new concepts in a growing market with a changing surgical setting toward robotics and minimally invasive surgery. Additionally, the department plays a strategic role in production expansion projects, addressing material changes, material science, and the definition and management of Critical Quality Attributes (CQAs) to ensure scalability and quality in production.




The department consists of a highly skilled team of 17 scientists, engineers, and technicians who cover various scientific and technical disciplines, such as chemistry, biochemistry, pharmaceutical science, process engineering, design research, and prototyping. We are adding an R&D Data Scientist to the department to become more data-driven.




The department houses three laboratories, a machine shop, and a pilot facility. Instrumentation includes enzymatic activity assays, coagulation assays,UV-Vis spectroscopy, FTIR microscopy, DSC, adhesion/cohesion, rheology, mechanical test systems, texture analysis, mechanical processing, 3D printing, and pilot-scale processing equipment.




You will join a significant capacity expansion project centered around scaling up several central unit operations in our production line. The team comprises process engineers, biomaterial scientists, chemists, design engineers, and lab technicians.




The Product Innovation department is placed under New Business Development, and you report to the Product Innovation Director.




We are looking for an R&D Data Scientist to play a key role in driving and building more data-driven solutions within production and product development. In this position, you will work on optimizing production processes and supporting the development of new formulations by leveraging advanced analytics, multivariate analysis, and design of experiments (DOE).




Your role

A significant part of your role will be defining Critical Quality Attributes (CQAs), enabling data-driven decision-making in production expansion and early-stage innovation projects. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to establish a stronger foundation for data-driven practices, e.g., establishing correlations of intermediate material properties to upstream process variables or raw material properties.




One of your key assignments is a large-scale production expansion project involving a new production line. It will run for 2-4 years and leverage advanced process control methods (IPC). As part of the project team, you collaborate cross-functionally to define and set the criteria for Critical Quality Attributes (CQAs), ensuring they align with intermediate and product performance requirements. These CQAs will then be integrated into user requirement specifications for production equipment (URS), laying the foundation for robust monitoring systems.




You will use advanced tools like chemometric analysis and multivariate statistical methods. Through simulations and lab testing, you will analyze data to identify key attributes and validate their acceptance ranges. This ensures a seamless transition of CQAs into production, maintaining consistent quality and output. Additionally, you will support front-end innovation projects with data structure, multivariate analysis, and statistics in the development phases of new formulations, processes, device performance, and system integration.




Your role will include:

Defining and managing Critical Quality Attributes (CQAs) to ensure product quality and consistency.
Collaborating with your colleagues in Product Innovation, Technology Innovation, Process Support, and QA
Writing protocols and documentation
Using tools like JMP and MATLAB/PLS_Toolbox to analyze data, develop predictive models, and optimize processes
Validating CQAs through simulations, lab tests, and documentation to ensure product performance and support production ramp-up
Overseeing the integration of CQAs into production processes
Support front-end innovation projects with data structure, multivariate analysis, and statistics




The ideal candidate

You have a strong academic background in, for example, pharmaceutical or food science, chemistry, or chemical/process engineering, and you have experience in production upscaling, process optimization, or late-phase process development.

You have hands-on expertise with tools such as JMP and MATLAB Toolboxes, particularly the PLS_Toolbox, and you are skilled in applying chemometric techniques to solve complex challenges.




You are familiar with defining and managing Critical Quality Attributes (CQAs) and contributing to process validation and optimization. You thrive in project team environments, collaborating closely with colleagues across disciplines to ensure high-quality outcomes.

You approach your work with a structured mindset, focusing on details and delivering high-quality data analysis and documentation. You are comfortable managing complex datasets and translating them into actionable insights.




In addition, your profile contains




Academic background: Master’s or Ph.D. in life sciences (pharmaceutical or food science, chemistry, or chemical/process engineering)
General experience with pharmaceutical or food processes and production techniques
Expertise with MVA tools such as JMP and MATLAB Toolboxes, particularly the PLS Toolbox, is an advantage
Experience with programming languages, such as Python or MATLAB’, is an advantage
Familiarity with other tools and software for data analysis and process optimization is a must
You are skilled in applying chemometric techniques to solve complex challenges and data-driven insights
Expertise in Design of Experiments (DOE) and Multivariate Analysis is essential
General knowledge of laboratory techniques and engineering principles for pharmaceutical development and manufacturing.
Science curiosity, solution-orientated, and pragmaticapproach
Strong interpersonal skills and a self-starting collaborative personality
Ability to put your work into a cross-functional reference
Strong oral/written communication skills




Ferrosan Medical Devices as a workplace




An international organization with about 350 employees and a strong collaborative culture with solid Danish roots. An environment where you discuss matters with your colleagues and key stakeholders and canexpect everyone to take responsibility for common results. The organization is flat and informal.




How to come into consideration




Please contact: Partner at Peoplement, Anne Borgen, either by mail: anne@peoplement.dk or phone +45 6169 0101 for more information.

Note: A valid work permit for Denmark is required.

Title: AI/ML Expert
Description:
Spændende karrieremulighed som AI/ML-ekspert hos Trifork!

Om jobbet

Hos Trifork arbejder vi strategisk med machine learning og AI. Sammen med vores kunder udvikler vi værdiskabende løsninger baseret på moderne teknologier herunder Machine Learning / Conversational AI / Vision AI / Generative AI, Cloud løsninger, backend services, web- og mobilapplikationer. Vi udvikler løsninger for såvel store enterprise virksomheder som mindre start-ups.

Er du en passioneret og erfaren AI/ML-ekspert som har en trang til at engagere sig med kunder?

Trifork leder lige nu efter en dygtig profil til at joine vores team og bidrage med cutting-edge AI løsninger til vores kunder. Vi har fokus indenfor AI (Vision/Generative/Conversational) samt Machine Learning. Hvis du trives i et samarbejdende miljø, har en stærk baggrund inden for softwareudvikling og brænder for at gøre en forskel, kunne dette være den perfekte rolle for dig!

Nogle Af Dine Ansvarsområder


Teknisk ekspertise: Udfold din ekspertise inden for AI/ML til at udvikle og levere avancerede løsninger som dækker kundernes behov og være med til at sætte præg på retningen indenfor AI/ML i afdelingen
Kundeengagement: At engagere sig med kunder for at forstå deres behov og samarbejde omkring levering af innovative AI løsninger.
Forretningsudvikling: Udvise flair for og identificere forretningsmuligheder samt være en aktiv spiller ift. udarbejdelse af strategiske salgbare AI/ML løsninger


Hvem er du?


Du er passioneret omkring at arbejde indenfor tech industrien. Du elsker teknologi, software- og applikationsudvikling!
Du har gåpåmod, et positivt mindset og evner at arbejde både selvstændigt og som en god holdspiller
Du har en udadvendt personlighed som bringer god energi, stemning og humor ind på kontoret
Du er en dygtig kommunikator med et stærkt analytisk mindset som hjælper dig med at fokusere på hvad der er vigtigt
Du har en naturlig interesse og forståelse omkring ny teknologi er i stand til at forbinde denne viden i hvordan det hjælper vores kunder


Vi Forventer, At Du Har


En højere videregående uddannelse på kandidat- eller bachelorniveau inden for et IT relevant område
Erfaring indenfor Vision AI, Conversational AI, Generative AI/LLM og Machine Learning
Erfaring med udvikling og levering af succesfulde AI løsninger som du kan fremvise
Et agilt mindset som efterlever de agile principper og gerne vil arbejde med Scrum
Evnerne til at kommunikere og præsentere på et højt professionelt niveau både på dansk og engelsk
Struktureret med et naturligt drive og tilgang til at nedbryde kompleksitet ned til klarhed og actions samt fokusere på de rigtige detaljer på de rigtige tidspunkter
Får energi ved at interagere med forskellige mennesker og bruger din sociale bevidsthed til at skabe et konstruktivt og positivt arbejdsmiljø


Hvad vi tilbyder

Vores daglige arbejde er karakteriseret af en åben og ærlig atmosfære, og vi sætter fokus på at skabe et fagligt udfordrende men også sjovt arbejdsmiljø. Vi afholder fx løbende tech talks til aftenarrangementer, hvor du enten kan lære nyt sammen med andre ansatte og gæster, eller være den, der lærer fra dig.

Vi arbejder i agile multifunktionelle teams med et fokus på tæt samarbejde med vores kunder. Professionel sparring er vigtigt for os, og derfor har du altid en kollega med på din opgave.

Nye medarbejdere får en mentor/buddy tildelt, så der altid er en kollega at spørge hvis der er noget man er i tvivl om. Det er vigtigt for os at nye medarbejdere bliver godt integreret og hurtigt føler sig trygge og som en del af vores afdeling.

Efter de første måneder du er startet hos Trifork, vil du få muligheden for at blive inviteret på vores "Family Training" med vores grundlægger og CEO sammen med andre nye kollegaer fra Trifork kontorer rundt om i verden. Family Training foregår som regel i vores eget Casa Maria på Mallorca.

Trifork - en betroet teknologisk partner

I Trifork tager vi ansvar for kundens løsning og løser deres udfordringer i tæt samarbejde med kunden. Vi har øje for kundens forretning og skaber løsninger der gennem løbende innovation understøtter deres udvikling mange år frem. Vi positionerer os selv med vores kunder som en betroet teknologisk partner, og har en arbejdsmodel hvor vi fokuserer på at sætte det rigtige udvikler-team der arbejder tæt sammen i et agilt setup fra vores eget kontorer.

Ikke mere end 42 mennesker på kontoret

Hvorfor, spørger du så? Vi ønsker at sikre at et kontor ikke bliver for stort, så du altid ved hvem du sidder ved siden af. Ved ikke at have for store kontorer, sikrer vi at have en uformel og afslappet kultur, hvor alle kender hinanden. Det gør også at vi er små autonome enheder og hvor medbestemmelse/indflydelse på hverdagen er en væsentlig faktor. Så på trods af, at Trifork er en virksomhed med mere end 1000 ansatte, så føles det ofte som at arbejde i en startup virksomhed med et stærkt og samarbejdsvenligt miljø, hvor alle kan blive hørt.

Derudover Tilbyder Vi


Hacker Days - to gange om året tager vi to dage væk fra vores kontor, for at dykke ned i helt nye og spændende teknologier (se videoen nedenfor)
GOTO konference - mulighed for at tage på GOTO eller anden relevant konference og lærer om super trends og state-of-the-art teknologier
Uformelt arbejdsmiljø og højt humør
Høj grad af faglighed og vidensdeling mellem udviklere via interessegrupper
Mulighed for at bruge de nyeste teknologier i dine projekter
Årlig strategitur med fokus på teambuilding og virksomhedskultur. De senere år tæller Mallorca, Obertauern, Zürich
Mulighed for Crossfit hver mandag og løbeklub hver torsdag
Mulighed for Scrum master Certificering
Central beliggende kontor midt i Aarhus tæt på offentlig transport eller mulighed for parkering
Spil bordfodbold med dine kollegaer på vores Bonzini bord
Lækker varierende frokostordning
Friskkværnet kaffe brygget på vores fine italienske kaffemaskine
Morgenbrød om mandagen, snacks og frugt, torsdagskage, fredagsrundstykker
Et velassorteret køleskab med både cocio, sodavand m.m.
Fredagsbar
Kvartalsmøder i afdelingen med efterfølgende aktiviteter og spisning
Macbook Pro eller high-end Dell og fri telefon


Vi håber du synes at jobbet og Trifork lyder spændende, og vi ser frem til at modtage din ansøgning. For at behandle din ansøgning så hurtigt som muligt, vil vi opfordre dig til at du i din ansøgning adresserer de forventninger vi har til dig.
Show more
HTML:
Spændende karrieremulighed som AI/ML-ekspert hos Trifork!

Om jobbet

Hos Trifork arbejder vi strategisk med machine learning og AI. Sammen med vores kunder udvikler vi værdiskabende løsninger baseret på moderne teknologier herunder Machine Learning / Conversational AI / Vision AI / Generative AI, Cloud løsninger, backend services, web- og mobilapplikationer. Vi udvikler løsninger for såvel store enterprise virksomheder som mindre start-ups.

Er du en passioneret og erfaren AI/ML-ekspert som har en trang til at engagere sig med kunder?

Trifork leder lige nu efter en dygtig profil til at joine vores team og bidrage med cutting-edge AI løsninger til vores kunder. Vi har fokus indenfor AI (Vision/Generative/Conversational) samt Machine Learning. Hvis du trives i et samarbejdende miljø, har en stærk baggrund inden for softwareudvikling og brænder for at gøre en forskel, kunne dette være den perfekte rolle for dig!

Nogle Af Dine Ansvarsområder

  • Teknisk ekspertise: Udfold din ekspertise inden for AI/ML til at udvikle og levere avancerede løsninger som dækker kundernes behov og være med til at sætte præg på retningen indenfor AI/ML i afdelingen
  • Kundeengagement: At engagere sig med kunder for at forstå deres behov og samarbejde omkring levering af innovative AI løsninger.
  • Forretningsudvikling: Udvise flair for og identificere forretningsmuligheder samt være en aktiv spiller ift. udarbejdelse af strategiske salgbare AI/ML løsninger

Hvem er du?

  • Du er passioneret omkring at arbejde indenfor tech industrien. Du elsker teknologi, software- og applikationsudvikling!
  • Du har gåpåmod, et positivt mindset og evner at arbejde både selvstændigt og som en god holdspiller
  • Du har en udadvendt personlighed som bringer god energi, stemning og humor ind på kontoret
  • Du er en dygtig kommunikator med et stærkt analytisk mindset som hjælper dig med at fokusere på hvad der er vigtigt
  • Du har en naturlig interesse og forståelse omkring ny teknologi er i stand til at forbinde denne viden i hvordan det hjælper vores kunder

Vi Forventer, At Du Har

  • En højere videregående uddannelse på kandidat- eller bachelorniveau inden for et IT relevant område
  • Erfaring indenfor Vision AI, Conversational AI, Generative AI/LLM og Machine Learning
  • Erfaring med udvikling og levering af succesfulde AI løsninger som du kan fremvise
  • Et agilt mindset som efterlever de agile principper og gerne vil arbejde med Scrum
  • Evnerne til at kommunikere og præsentere på et højt professionelt niveau både på dansk og engelsk
  • Struktureret med et naturligt drive og tilgang til at nedbryde kompleksitet ned til klarhed og actions samt fokusere på de rigtige detaljer på de rigtige tidspunkter
  • Får energi ved at interagere med forskellige mennesker og bruger din sociale bevidsthed til at skabe et konstruktivt og positivt arbejdsmiljø

Title: Biomedical Machine Learning Engineer Intern
Place: Frederiksberg Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Join IMP SCANDINAVIA, a dynamic MedTech Start-Up revolutionizing the healthcare sector with our intelligent monitoring technology. We are seeking a motivated Biomedical Digital Signal Processing intern to contribute to our research and development team. If you're a hands-on, self-driven individual with a passion for improving patient outcomes, this is the perfect opportunity for you.

The Job?

IMP is currently looking for a hands-on, self-driven, energetic Biomedical Digital Signal Processing intern to join our research and development team. This position is responsible for developing creative solutions to significant unmet medical needs that align with IMP objectives. The digital signal processing aspect of the work involves innovating new approaches to analyzing human data over time including physiological data.

Responsibilities


Design of advance signal processing algorithms for portable diagnostic devices.
Develop machine learning and deep learning models for various vital sign calculations
Collaborate with our tech stack to operationalize applications, including API development.
Drive product innovation by exploring new ways to improve our offerings.
Document progress and utilize critical thinking for decision-making on implemented methods.


Your daily tasks will be designed in close corporation with the CTO and our R&D team.

Qualifications


Have at least a BSc in Biomedical Engineering, Electric Engineering, Computer science or similar health science engineering degree.
Strong knowledge of physiology of biological systems such as heart, lungs, and brain etc.
Proficiency in DSP, Data Science Pattern recognition, and ML/DL for DSP.
Strong programming skills in Python/MATLAB and object-oriented programming.
Experience in Embedded C (Optional)
Quick and Independent learner, not afraid of taking initiatives.
Passion for delivering solutions in the healthcare sector.
Familiar with the regulations and standards implications for the documentation of a medical device.


What We Offer


Join a team of passionate individuals and make a real impact on our business.
Flexible working hours to make the most of your time.
Hybrid work opportunities, allowing you to perform at your best.
We value eagerness to learn and positive energy, so apply even if you meet only some of the criteria.
Expect responsibility, challenges, professional and personal growth, and 24/7 office space availability.
Enjoy social events and receive a letter of recommendation.


For more information, please contact us and to apply, please send us an application via The Hub. Join IMP and be part of our mission to enhance patient quality of life, streamline supervision and monitoring, and empower health-related decision-making in the healthcare sector.
Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Pandora, we are transforming the retail experience with cutting-edge technology. Our mission is to provide an exceptional shopping experience to our customers by leveraging data-driven insights and innovative solutions across our business. We are looking for a talented Machine Learning Engineer to join our dynamic team and help us shape the future of retail.

Job Summary:

As a Machine Learning Engineer at Pandora, you will play a key role in developing and deploying machine learning models that drive impactful decisions and elevate customer experiences. You will collaborate closely with a diverse group of data scientists, data engineers, and business leaders to create scalable solutions that optimize our retail operations across the full value chain – covering jewellery design and crafting, supply chain logistics, to instore/online retail and marketing. We encourage creative problem-solving, continuous learning, and work-life balance in a supportive environment.

Key Responsibilities:


Model Development: Work in end-to-end analytical products, from exploration and prototyping to productizing and testing, helping to solve complex business problems across the full value chain.
Data Pipeline Engineering: Develop and maintain data pipelines for collecting, processing, and analyzing large datasets, ensuring data quality and consistency.
Model Deployment: Deploy machine learning models into production environments, ensuring they are scalable, reliable, and easy to maintain.
Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including data scientists, software engineers, MLOps engineers, product managers, and business stakeholders, to understand business needs and translate them into machine learning solutions.
Performance Monitoring: Continuously monitor the performance of deployed models and implement improvements to enhance their accuracy, efficiency, and scalability.
Research & Innovation: Stay up-to-date with the latest developments in machine learning and AI, and apply new techniques to improve existing models and processes.
Documentation: Maintain clear and comprehensive documentation of models, processes, and systems to facilitate knowledge sharing and collaboration.



Qualifications:

Education: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, or a related field.

Experience:


3+ years of experience as a Machine Learning Engineer, Data Scientist, or similar role.
Experience in the retail industry or e-commerce is highly desirable.



Technical Skills:


Strong problem-solving abilities, solid background in algorithms and data structures.
Strong proficiency in Python.
Ability to work with machine learning tools (eg. scikit-learn, tensorflow, keras, pytorch, Spark MLlib).
Experience with big data using Databricks, Snowflake, Apache Spark or Hadoop.
Proficiency in SQL and experience with relational databases.
System level architecture understanding including scaling, MLOps, model/data monitoring, and ensuring a deterministic pipeline.
Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., Azure) and containerization technologies (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).
Experience with version control systems (e.g., Git) and collaborative development tools (e.g., JIRA, Confluence).



Soft Skills:


Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
A proactive attitude and a passion for continuous learning and innovation.



Our Pandora Values

We dream, are visionary and go beyond the obvious. 

We dare to pursue bold ambitions with courage and speed. 

We care deeply about each other, our customers and the planet we all share. Every day we strive to be a fulfilling workplace, where each of us can thrive and contribute, where talents can grow, and 

We deliver on our promises to colleagues, customers, partners and stakeholders.

We are focused on building a diverse and inclusive workforce. If you’re excited about this role, but do not meet 100% of the qualifications listed above, we encourage you to apply.

Did we get your attention

If you see yourself in the position and would like to become a part of Pandora’s future, please do not hesitate to apply. We look forward to hearing from you!

We process applications on a continuous basis, which is why we encourage you to send your application as soon as possible. You can also read more about Pandora on our corporate site www.pandoragroup.com.

Icing on the cake

You will be working out of our beautiful Head Office in Copenhagen V, established in 2016 and designed to unite and inspire our teams. Besides our beautiful interior design we are also proud of our LEED Gold Certification for Energy and Environmental Design. This means that we use as few natural resources as possible and that we use them with respect. The result is a professional and dynamic space that is unique, comfortable and inspirational – and delivers a true Pandora experience to anyone who works here or comes to visit.

About Pandora

Established in 1982, Pandora designs, manufactures and markets hand-finished jewellery made from high-quality materials at affordable prices. Pandora’s products are available in more than 100 countries on six continents through more than 6,500 points of sale, including around 2,500 concept stores.

Headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark, Pandora employs 32,000 people worldwide and crafts its jewellery at two LEED certified facilities in Thailand, using mainly recycled silver and gold. The company plans to be carbon neutral by 2025 and has joined the Science Based Targets initiative to reduce emissions across its full value chain. Pandora is listed on the Nasdaq Copenhagen stock exchange and generated a revenue of DKK 28.1 billion in 2023. 

At Pandora, we believe that creating an inclusive and diverse workplace and reflecting societal diversity in our customer engagement is essential to delivering on our company purpose: to give a voice to people’s loves. We dedicate ourselves to fostering, cultivating and preserving a culture of inclusion and diversity where everyone feels respected and valued.

Title: Internship: Data Scientist
Description:
Internship:
Data Scientist 

Dreaming of working with high-quality software that makes a real difference? Then seize this opportunity and apply for an internship as a Data Scientist at Systematic! 

More than just an internship 
As a Data Scientist intern, you will join our SitaWare Insight team which is part of our Defence business unit. SitaWare Insight is a decision-support tool that transforms data collection and management, providing commanders at various levels with advanced data capture and analysis capabilities. The mission for the program is to simplify critical decision-making. Modern technologies like AI are used to transform data into information, providing commanders with advanced data capture and analysis capabilities. 

As an intern, you will play a vital role in the team, contribute to the advancement of modern technologies and be treated on a par with the other employees. Moreover, you will become an integrated part of a team from day one, receiving the professional sparring and feedback you need to succeed.  

Freedom with responsibilities 

Our new intern will get to make a real difference working with high-quality software, while you will have every opportunity to apply what you have learnt so far on your study programme. In addition, some of your daily tasks include contributing to daily advancements and developing and documenting code according to agile principles while using Python and other relevant technologies. 

In so far as possible, you will be able to plan your own tasks as we strive to create the right balance between your personal wishes, your formal study requirements and our expectations. 

You are our new intern  

… if you are studying for a BSc or MSc in Cognitive Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Data Science, Computer Engineering or similar. And if you work systematically, are motivated by the quality of your work and always maintain a focus on the details. 

Throughout your internship, the focus will be on developing your competencies, which we envisage are as follows:
  

You take an interest in, are knowledgeable about or have experience with LLMs and natural language processing methods. 
You possess experience at developing or implementing machine learning models. 
You are proficient with Python and popular ML frameworks such as PyTorch, Transformers or TensorFlow.  
You are proficient in data preprocessing and feature engineering. 
You understand data handling, model evaluation, the visualisation of data-driven solutions and the development of best practices. 
You speak and write English fluently as it is our corporate language. It is also an advantage if you can speak Danish, but this is not a requirement.  



Practical information    

The internship lasts five months, starting 18th August 2025.   
The internship is a full-time position.  
When applying, please include your CV as well as your exam certificates.   
We will be assessing job applications as we receive them, as we are keen to fill the position as soon as possible. We look forward to hearing from you!    



   

Please note that you must be able to present a clean criminal record and have lived in a NATO/EU country for the past seven years as we work with security-classified projects. Read more here.    

    

Never stop developing     

Systematic is truly international, proudly Danish and uniquely people-centric. Together, we write intelligent and innovative code to drive progress and improve lives. We develop IT solutions that make a real difference where it matters most. This is why we never stop developing. Here, there is room to be professional and personal. It is not just a place to work but a place to belong.     

   

In addition to your team, you will become part of an Intern network with other Interns at Systematic, providing you with a rich opportunity to network across the organisation. You can also look forward to joining our Employees Club, which offers almost 100 social/professional events a year. Our colleagues also highlight our canteen, which serves a variety of delicious and healthy dishes each day. Finally, we are always up for a friendly game of padel at our new padel court in Aarhus!    

  

Start your development here    

We will be assessing applications on an ongoing basis as we wish to welcome our new colleague as soon as possible, so click Apply Now and send us your CV today. If you have any questions, you are always welcome to contact us on tel. +45 8943 2000 and ask for Preben Schmidt Nielsen, Senior Project Manager.

Get in touch

Helene Overgaard Bach

Junior Consultant

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Join one of Denmark’s most rapidly growing SaaS companies




Are you someone who takes ownership of tasks, sees projects through with focus, and thrives on creative problem-solving? Do you enjoy uncovering patterns in data and transforming insights into actionable solutions? If you're motivated by continuous improvement and strategic thinking, this might be the perfect opportunity for you.




At PriceShape, we value collaboration and the drive to contribute to meaningful advancements. You’ll bring structure to complex problems and communicate findings to inspire action, all while contributing to the evolution of our technology and e-commerce platform.




Job description




As a Data Scientist at PriceShape, you will play an essential role in analyzing, modeling, and deriving insights from data that drives our platform's core functionalities. You will focus on building predictive models, analyzing trends, and optimizing e-commerce-related processes using structured data.




Your day-to-day work will be together with an international team, working closely with your Team Lead, our CTO, Head of Engineering and our full-stack developers. Our department consists of colleagues from various parts of the world and English is the primary language for communication.




Your key responsibilities consist of the following:




Supporting the development and deployment of machine learning and deep learning models, contributing to the process from ideation to implementation under the guidance of the team lead.
Assisting in advanced time series analyses for e-commerce data, such as sales forecasting and inventory management.
Writing and optimizing complex SQL queries to extract, manipulate, and analyze data.
Collaborating with software developers to implement data-driven solutions into the platform.
Conducting exploratory data analysis and presenting insights to the team lead and relevant stakeholders.




We expect you to bring the following:

We value practical experience as much as formal education. Your hands-on skills and curiosity are what matter most. We're looking for someone who is self-sufficient, eager to learn, and passionate about data science.




Must-Have Skills

Strong experience with Python and relevant libraries (e.g., Pandas, Numpy, Scikit-learn, TensorFlow…).
Proficiency in SQL, with the ability to write complex queries involving joins, subqueries, and aggregations.
A solid understanding of machine learning algorithms (supervised and unsupervised learning) and their practical applications in sales data.
Practical experience in time series analysis for solving business problems like sales forecasting and inventory management.
Experience deploying and maintaining machine learning models in a production environment using AWS services.
Strong understanding of feature engineering techniques.
Experience with software engineering best practices such as version control and testing.




Good-to-Have Skills

Familiarity with working on sales and customer data in e-commerce.
Ability to quickly understand e-commerce-specific datasets and use them effectively.
Basic knowledge of deep learning, particularly LSTMs (Long Short-Term Memory networks).




What you can expect from us:




A great career opportunity for continuous growth alongside your team and the company.
An informal, international startup culture that prioritizes work-life balance.
Flexible working hours, with a base at our new office in Aarhus C.
Computer and equipment of your choice.
Social events like parties, poker nights, and padel tennis.




About PriceShape

PriceShape is a fast-growing company with potential for personal and professional growth. We are a young SaaS company that develops and sells a price optimization tool for e-commerce stores and brands worldwide. PriceShape has around 90 employees with our daily operations in Aarhus.




How to apply

If you think the position is attractive and suitable, please send us a job application and your CV as soon as possible. We process and interview on an ongoing basis. For clarifications about the position, you can contact our CTO, Brian Hansen, at +45 60 67 31 31 or brha@priceshape.dk.

Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Place: Hørsholm, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We are looking for a Machine Learning Engineer to join our Software and AI Solutions department at Gubra. In this role, you will collaborate closely with data scientists and software developers to deploy, monitor, and manage machine learning models in production, ensuring robust and scalable ML pipelines.




State-of-the-art ML models in multiple domains

In this role, you will handle ML models from multiple domains. Our most established domains are biomedical image analysis and machine learning based design of pharmaceuticals. Gubra is a leader in high throughput 3D imaging, and an early adopter of digital histopathology. We have developed our own ML based drug discovery platform called streaMLine. The platform has reduced drug discovery time by 50%. Now, we are ready to apply ML to more parts of our business, and you will play a large part in that.




In addition, we are currently investigating areas where generative AI can make our processes more efficient. If interested, you could be instrumental in designing and building solutions with elements from generative AI.




Your primary tasks will be to:

Design, implement, and manage ML applications
Manage model versions and ensure smooth integration into production systems
Build and maintain automated pipelines for data ingestion, preprocessing, training, validation, and inference in production
Ensure ML models and pipelines are scalable to handle varying loads and diverse data.




Proven Machine Learning experience

At Gubra, we believe that sharing knowledge is key to success. Therefore, you will be part of a team where collaboration and the willingness to share early-stage ideas are essential. We promise that you will learn from us, and we are looking forward to learning from you.




We are open to any levels of experience if you are motivated. Your qualifications could include:

A master's or PhD degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field
Proficiency in Python, including experience with machine learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch) and data processing libraries.
Experience applying data science and statistics to solve real problems.




Desirable qualifications

You do not necessarily need to have these qualifications, but we hope you are willing to learn, because you will use them actively in this position:

Knowledge of CI/CD tools and containerization
Experience with MLOps, including model monitoring, reproducibility, and data management
Experience with cloud or hybrid infrastructure
Motivation to learn about the biotech industry
Motivation to develop competencies in generative AI.




Software and AI Solutions – your new Team

You will join 16 skilled data scientists and developers in the Software and AI Solutions department at Gubra HQ in Hørsholm, on the edge of Greater Copenhagen. The department focuses on developing advanced tools to support all aspects of our biotechnology and research business.




We work in an informal and inclusive environment. We like to share knowledge and help each other. We look forward to welcoming you to the team.




Contact and application

We encourage you to submit your application as soon as possible, as we will be reviewing applications on an ongoing basis. Please upload your motivated cover letter, resume and relevant diplomas on our website no later than March 9, 2025.




If you have any questions, you are very welcome to contact Senior Department Manager, Casper Salinas at cgs@gubra.dk. If necessary, we will set up an additional call to ensure your understanding of the job and your many opportunities.




We look forward to receiving your application.




About Gubra

Gubra is an ambitious contract research organisation (CRO) and biotech company striving for excellence at all levels. We insist on doing things efficiently – and often differently - to achieve the results we aim for. Our vision is to become leaders in the fight for a healthier and more sustainable world. We do that by facilitating the discovery of new medicine, and by acting and inspiring others to fight the ongoing climate and biodiversity crises.




Gubra’s activities are focused on the early stages of drug development and are organised in two highly synergistic business areas: CRO Services and Discovery & Partnerships (D&P). We generate our revenue by performing research for life science companies as well as by partnering projects from our discovery and development pipeline.




Our therapeutic focus is within metabolic and fibrotic diseases, and we specialize in in vivo pharmacology, ex vivo assays, drug profiling, histology, stereology and whole brain and organ imaging. In addition, we offer a full palette of advanced transcriptomics. Our ML/AI-driven peptide drug discovery platform streaMLine enables us to rapidly develop a peptide hit into a non-clinical candidate ready for development. Through a constant focus on high quality, scientific excellence, speed, and solid teamwork we have established ourselves as a highly professional and competent partner in the market.




People are our greatest asset, and our team consists of +260 employees all located in Hørsholm, Denmark. The mix of people from different cultures and educational backgrounds combined with our entrepreneurial mindset have greatly impacted our working environment, which is characterized by entrepreneurial drive, scientific curiosity, and teamwork – we join forces!




Check out www.gubra.dk for more inspiration.

Title: Research Scientist at Personalized Medicine Company
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Research Scientist Position at Personalized Medicine Startup




Lab Operations and Biomarker Assay Development




GLX Analytix is revolutionizing personalized medicine through our groundbreaking GLX Signature Platform, combining innovative vascular biology with AI technology. As a clinical-stage, Silicon Valley-backed company, we're transforming care for patients with neurodegenerative, autoimmune, cardiovascular, and neuropsychiatric diseases.




Position Overview We're seeking a passionate Research Scientist to join our laboratory team in Copenhagen. You'll play a vital role in advancing our liquid biopsy platform, working under the guidance of our Laboratory Manager to develop and validate novel biomarker assays.




Your Impact - First 3 Months

·      Master our standardized laboratory protocols for blood sample processing

·      Support high-throughput immunoassay operations

·      Assist in validation studies for analytical and clinical performance

·      Document procedures and results according to regulatory standards

·      Contribute to laboratory automation initiatives




Your Impact - First Year

·      Preparation of GLX Signature Tests for regulatory filings

·      Support scaling of sample processing operations

·      Contribute to biomarker-discovery initiatives

·      Develop and optimize new analytical methods

·      Support US market expansion




Laboratory Focus

·      Processing large volumes of blood samples with precision

·      Executing complex immunoassay protocols (ELISA, Luminex, MSD)

·      Performing protein and glycan-based antibody purification

·      Maintaining quality control systems

·      Supporting method validation studies

·      Collaborating with data science team on assay optimization




Required Qualifications

·      MSc or PhD in biomedicine, bioengineering, chemistry, or related field

·      1-5 years of industry experience (post-doctoral applicants welcome)

·      Strong foundation in laboratory techniques and documentation

·      Experience with immunoassay platforms and development of biomarker assays




Technical Skills

·      Proficiency in immunoassay techniques and assay development

·      Experience with: Luminex, MSD, ELISA, Simoa, and/or Cobas platforms

·      Knowledge of protein/glycan-based antibody purification and coupling chemistry

·      Understanding of quality control systems

·      Laboratory automation experience




Ideal Candidate

·      Enjoys and excels at hands-on laboratory work

·      Takes pride in precise bench work and manual laboratory techniques

·      Detail-oriented with strong documentation skills

·      Excellent team player with collaborative mindset

·      Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects

·      Strong commitment to laboratory safety and quality

·      Passion for translational research




Bonus Qualifications

·      Experience with glycan and/or antibody bioengineering

·      Background in glycobiology and/or neurodegenerative, autoimmune, or cardiovascular disease

·      Familiarity with laboratory automation systems

·      Experience with biofluids analysis

·      Quality Management Systems (QMS) laboratory experience




Position Details

·      Ideal Start Date: April 1, 2024 (flexible)

·      Location: Copenhagen, Denmark

·      Type: Full-time with competitive compensation

·      Requirements: Valid Danish work permit and English fluency

·      Reports to: Laboratory Manager and Principal Scientist




About GLX Analytix Award-winning, venture-backed personalized medicine company pioneering advanced glycobiology research and novel blood biomarkers. Partnerships with leading medical institutions in Europe and the United States. Focused on transforming early detection and treatment monitoring for conditions including Alzheimer's Disease, Multiple Sclerosis, ALS, and Major Depressive Disorder.




How to Apply Submit to info@glxanalytix.com or via LinkedIn Job Post:

·      CV

·      Updated transcripts

·      Letter of interest

·      Professional references

·      Letters of recommendation (optional)




Application Timeline Rolling review until position is filled.




Keywords: Bioengineering, Glycobiology, Immunoassays, Luminex, Antibody Purification, Mass Spectrometry, Laboratory Standardization, Automation, Regulatory Compliance




Follow us on Linkedin: glxanalytix




www.glxanalytix.com




Join us in our mission to transform patient care through innovative diagnostics. GLX Analytix offers significant opportunities for professional growth and the chance to make a real impact in personalized medicine.




Winner of Roche Future of Healthcare Startup Award




"...this approach has a clear potential to improve the lives of patients all over the world.”

-      Dr. Tim M. Jaeger, Global SVP of Provider Insights and Roche Information Solutions, Roche

-      Dr. Tim M. Jaeger, Global SVP of Provider Insights and Roche Information Solutions, Roche

Title: Data Scientist (Copenhagen)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you our new Data Scientist?




AudienceProject is looking for a Data Scientist for our Copenhagen office to support our continued growth.

—




Are you an analyst at heart? And do you have an interest in data modeling and programming? Then we have an opportunity for a career in a fast-growing scale-up that directly cooperates with companies such as Meta, Google, Amazon, Netflix, Disney+ etc.




AudienceProject is a leading SaaS company with 100+ employees delivering audience measurement and research solutions to major advertisers, agencies, and publishers across Europe.




Our platform enables clients to better understand the reach and effect of their campaigns across channels, helping them make confident marketing decisions to reach and impact their audiences more effectively.




Embarking on our second decade of audience measurement, we are now looking for a motivated Data Scientist to join our Data Science Research team.




Joining AudienceProject will give you a front-row seat in the rapidly evolving marketing technology sector and an opportunity to work within a respected business, delivering insights about audiences across the world's largest media channels to top-tier clients and some of the world’s biggest brands.




What you will do




You will be tasked with developing and implementing new methodologies related to both our platform as well as work on bespoke solutions for top-tier clients.




In the Data Science Research team, you will work with seven other team members and have close collaboration with the developers in our Tech department. The team is small and dynamic, and there is plenty of room for innovation and good ideas are quickly turned into action.

You will use Databricks notebooks hosted on our cloud servers to interact with S3 for exploratory data analysis, visualizations and modeling. This is done in PySpark (or SparkR) since the vast amounts of data truly require distributed computing.

Essential qualifications

You have a Master's degree or higher education in a numerically oriented education. Candidates with a social science background, specializing in statistics and data analysis, are also welcome to apply.
You have experience with data wrangling and analysis of large datasets and have developed a good intuition for how data can be used to create business insights.
You have a solid understanding of classical statistics techniques, including various regression analyses.
You have programming/scripting skills. Our current toolbox includes Python and R. It is an advantage to have good knowledge of at least one of these languages, as the position is primarily programming-oriented.
You are curious, structured, and goal-oriented. You enjoy diving into complex issues but understand that the goal is to find workable solutions.
You can communicate your results in a non-technical manner and understand how to make complex data analysis useful for non-data scientists.

Further qualifications

Experience working with simulations, Bayesian statistics, and machine learning models.
Experience with "human-centered" analysis and experience with analyzing attitudinal data, such as survey and/or online behavioral data.
An ability to understand the business implications of data and how to use it to build a strategic story that engages customers.

Relevant working experience is viewed as a plus but is not a strict requirement.




What we offer




A unique career opportunity in a fast-growing scale-up full of curious, intelligent and creative people where you can grow as we grow our company.




Competitive salary
Pension scheme and health insurance
Home internet paid
Central Copenhagen office
Hybrid work model
Daily breakfast
Lunch made by an on-site chef
Unlimited snacks, drinks and coffee
Friday bars and quarterly company dinners
International environment
Friendly, supportive and helpful colleagues
Innovative and market-leading products and services
Exposure to a lot of data handling
Technically/commercially challenging tasks
Working directly with some of the most modern and successful companies of our time
Mentorship from thought leaders in the industry




Send us your application




If you can see yourself in the above and want to work for a leading SaaS company, we want to hear from you.




If you have any questions about the position, please contact Jacob Daniel Kirstejn Hansen at jacobh@audienceproject.com.




We invite candidates for interviews on an ongoing basis, so please don’t hesitate to send your application. Apply by filling out the application form on our website.




The deadline for applications is February 24th, 2025. We will be inviting applicants for interviews on an ongoing basis.




We look forward to receiving your application!






Show more

Title: Data Scientist, Denmark - BCG X
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Who We Are

Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact.

To succeed, organizations must blend digital and human capabilities. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives to spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting along with technology and design, corporate and digital ventures—and business purpose. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, generating results that allow our clients to thrive.

We Are BCG X

We’re a diverse team of more than 3,000 tech experts united by a drive to make a difference. Working across industries and disciplines, we combine our experience and expertise to tackle the biggest challenges faced by society today. We go beyond what was once thought possible, creating new and innovative solutions to the world’s most complex problems. Leveraging BCG’s global network and partnerships with leading organizations, BCG X provides a stable ecosystem for talent to build game-changing businesses, products, and services from the ground up, all while growing their career. Together, we strive to create solutions that will positively impact the lives of millions.

What You'll Do

Our BCG X teams own the full analytics value-chain end to end: framing new business challenges, designing innovative algorithms, implementing, and deploying scalable solutions, and enabling colleagues and clients to fully embrace AI. Our product offerings span from fully custom-builds to industry specific leading edge AI software solutions.

As a Data Scientist and Senior Data Scientist, you'll be part of our rapidly growing team. You'll have the chance to apply data science methods and analytics to real-world business situations across a variety of industries to drive significant business impact. You'll have the chance to partner with clients in a variety of BCG regions and industries, and on key topics like climate change, enabling them to design, build, and deploy new and innovative solutions.

Additional responsibilities will include developing and delivering thought leadership in scientific communities and papers as well as leading conferences on behalf of BCG X. Successful candidates are intellectually curious builders who are biased toward action, scrappy, and communicative.

We Are Looking For Talented Individuals With a Passion For Data Science, Statistics, Operations Research And Transforming Organizations Into AI Led Innovative Companies. Successful Candidates Possess The Following


Comfortable in a client-facing role with the ambition to lead teams
Likes to distill complex results or processes into simple, clear visualizations
Explain sophisticated data science concepts in an understandable manner
Love building things and are comfortable working with modern development tools and writing code collaboratively (bonus points if you have a software development or DevOps experience)
Significant experience applying advanced analytics to a variety of business situations and a proven ability to synthesize complex data
Deep understanding of modern machine learning techniques and their mathematical underpinnings, and can translate this into business implications for our clients
Have strong project management skills


#BCGXjob

What You'll Bring

Technologies

Programming Languages: Python

Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws.

BCG is an E - Verify Employer. Click here for more information on E-Verify.
