Title: AI Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Your Role In Our Mission

We are looking for an AI Engineer to help us take systems that understand large technical documents and turn them into code. This is a job of excitement and exploration, requiring AI expertise and software engineering skills to build complex systems. Knowledge of semiconductors is a plus.

At Normal Computing, you will contribute to cutting-edge machine learning applications across various aspects of our business, working on solutions from the early stages of research and development to production deployment for our customers.

Responsibilities


Contribute to AI projects from concept to production deployment
Design and build systems using large language models to process complex technical documents
Develop solutions for multi-modal data handling (PDFs, logs, tables)
Solve challenging AI and software engineering problems
Work with other teams to integrate AI into our products
Create robust AI evaluation frameworks
Develop strategies to manage AI-specific challenges (latency, variance, errors)
Keep up with AI advancements, especially in language models and multi-modal AI


What Makes You A Great Fit


Experience with engineering projects, ideally related to ML or AI
Strong software engineering skills, especially with distributed systems
Proficiency in Python and ML frameworks (PyTorch, Hugging Face)
Experience with prompt engineering and deploying language models
Ability to handle and preprocess large, diverse datasets
Understanding of AI safety and responsible development
Knowledge of AI evaluation and benchmarking
Clear communication of complex AI concepts


Bonus Points For


Experience deploying AI in production environments
Cloud platform knowledge for AI deployment
Familiarity with advanced AI techniques (few-shot learning, meta-learning)
Open-source AI contributions or relevant publications
Ability to balance AI innovation with production-ready systems
Adaptability in a fast-paced, evolving AI landscape


Equal Employment Opportunity Statement

Normal Computing is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status.

Accessibility Accommodations

Normal Computing is committed to providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please let us know at accomodations@normalcomputing.ai.

Privacy Notice

By submitting your application, you agree that Normal Computing may collect, use, and store your personal information for employment-related purposes in accordance with our Privacy Policy.

Title: Senior Data Scientist in Super AI
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Are you an experienced IRB model developer who is looking for a new opportunity? Do you want to be part of shaping the future IRB model landscape in Danske Bank? Then come join our team of data scientists in the SuperAI department!

We are on a journey of fundamentally transforming our IRB model landscape to comply with recently implemented EBA guidelines and are looking for an expert to join us in developing best-in-class PD, LGD & EAD models for capital allocation, impairments, and internal steering.

You will join the IRB development team within the SuperAI department consisting of 80+ employees. Here, our aim is to build data science products to uncover and harness the value in our data and improve decision making at Danske Bank.

Our team oversees the entire model life cycle, from model design, to developing robust solutions in Python using best practices from software engineering to model implementation.


Depending on your experience, you may be offered a different seniority of the role.


You will:


Develop end-to-end data science solutions for PD, LGD, EAD models – from understanding the problem and designing the model, to deploying the final solution
Be a mentor for junior data scientists in the team, sharing your own knowledge and experience within data science, in general, and IRB modelling in particular
Communicate with non-technical stakeholders - distil complex concepts into a format that is easily understood, so that we can get the relevant business input to allow us to build representative and appropriate models
Participate in setting and documenting the standards and best practices for data science at Danske Bank


About you:


Deep knowledge of PD, LGD & EAD modelling through hands-on development and implementation of industry standard models in your previous workplace(s)/ including newly implemented EBA guidelines
Solid background in the mathematics underpinning data science and machine learning methodologies, as well as experience of implementing and deploying models using software engineering best practices
Experienced Python programmer (or similar OOP language)
Solid data science skills, especially within machine learning techniques applicable to IRB, storytelling through data and deployment of models to a production environment (version control, CI/CD tools, model performance tracking, etc.)
Good communication skills
Self-driven and collaborative mindset with the capability of thinking out-of-the-box
Upper-Intermediate English skills


Don't meet every single requirement? At Danske Bank we are committed to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace, so if you are interested in this role but your experience doesn't align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway.

“Everyone is welcome – bring your authentic and full self to work.”

We offer:

This position can be located both in Lithuania and Denmark. If the position is located in Lithuania the monthly salary range will be from 3280 EUR to 4920 EUR gross (based on your competencies relevant for the job).

Additionally, each Danske Bank employee receives employee benefits package (benefits are only valid for Lithuania the same as the salary ranges) which includes:


Growth opportunities: professional & supportive team, e-learnings, numerous development programs; (incl. professional certificates); 100+ professions for internal mobility opportunities.
Health & Well-being: a diverse, inclusive, work & life balance work environment; additional health insurance; mental well-being practices; partial psychologist counselling compensation; silence and sleep zones at the office; game rooms.
Hybrid working conditions: Work from home up to two days a week; home office budget (after the probation period); modern Danske Campus workplace developed with anthropologist for the best employee experience.
Additional days of leave: for rest, health, volunteering, exams in higher education institutions, and other important activities. Moreover, for seniority with Danske Bank.
Monetary compensation package: accidents & critical diseases insurance; financial support in case of unfortunate events, travel insurance; IIIrd Pillar Pension Fund contribution.


See all the benefits HERE.

Your title in job contract will be Data Scientist, Senior.

If you're interested in this role and joining my team, feel free to contact me - Kotryna Paulauskiene via LinkedIn, and I will answer your questions!

#DK

About Us

Danske Bank is a Nordic bank with bridges to the world around us. For 150 years, we have supported people and businesses in releasing their potential. A career with us is an opportunity to join a community of 22,000 colleagues in a culture where we are committed to Teaming Up, Owning It and Being Open. Together, we are on a journey to transform Danske Bank into a better bank. For our customers, our employees and the societies around us.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Place: Aarhus Municipality, Central Denmark Region, Denmark
Description:
Machine Learning Engineer

Motiveres du af at have en alsidig og spændende arbejdsgang, hvor du kan fordybe dig i Python kodning og implementering af machine learning modeller og mange andre spændende arbejdsopgaver, som du selv kan være med til at præge? Så kom og bring dine kompetencer i spil som vores nye Machine Learning Engineer til Vertica i Aarhus!




”Verti-hvem?”

Måske du har hørt om os? Måske ikke? Uanset hvad får du en lille intro her.

Hos Vertica bygger vi ecommerce. Det har vi gjort i mere end 20 år, og vi gør det sammen med nogle af landets førende virksomheder. Blandt vores kunder finder du Hørkram, Søstrene Grene, Molslinjen, Kvadrat, Brødrene Dahl og mange andre. Fælles for dem er, at de har et stort fokus på den brugerflade, som kunden møder, og det er her, vi hos Vertica kommer ind i billedet. For et års tid siden bredte vi vores ekspertise yderligere ud og startede vores AI og Data team, som arbejder på at hjælpe vores kunder med optimeringer ved hjælpe af AI og data drevne løsninger.




Du vil blive en del af vores nyetablerede AI og Data team, som består af kollegaer med forskellige baggrunde, hvor det som binder jer sammen, er jeres store interesse og faglighed indenfor data, AI og forretningsudvikling. Sammen sikrer I, hvordan I kan hjælpe vores kunder med at omsætte data til vigtige indsigter, som kan være med til at flytte og styrke deres forretning.




Da du er den første i denne specifikke rolle, vil du derfor have rig mulighed for sætte dit præg på, hvordan rollen skal udvikle sig, samt være med til at definere dine arbejdsopgaver. Men herunder er vores bud på, hvad du vil bruge en stor del af din tid på.




Dine opgaver bliver blandt andet:

Designe, bygge og levere værdiskabende ai-løsninger til en bred række af kunder i samarbejde med resten af AI og Data teamet.
Implementering af machine learning modeller: Samarbejde med vores Data Scientist for at bringe maskinlæringsmodeller fra udvikling til produktion samt sikre høj kvalitet, skalerbarhed og en stabil deployment-proces
Designe og implementerer MLOps workflows til at sikre en effektiv overgang fra Proof of Concept (poc) til produktion
Opsætte systemer til modelmonitorering, som muliggør løbende overvågning af modeller i produktion
Være med til at finde de bedste løsninger baseret på kundernes ønsker og behov




Vi forestiller os, at du har nedenstående kvalifikationer, men lige så̊ vigtigt er det, at du har lyst til at udvikle dig sammen med os og drive vores forretning mod nye højder




Vi søger dig, som har minimum 3 års relevant erhvervserfaring samt har et solidt teknisk grundlag og evnerne og forståelsen for at drive processer fra start til slut. Det er et plus, hvis du har erfaring med hele machine learning lifecycle.




Du har erfaring som konsulent og motiveres af at arbejde med AI projekter samt hjælpe kunder med at finde den bedste løsning til deres udfordringer




Du har erfaring med at sætte machine learning modeller i produktion
Du har stærke færdigheder og god erfaring med Python
Du har erfaring med MLOps (machine learning operations)
Du har flair og interesse for at arbejde med en bred vifte af AI løsninger herunder både generativ AI og klassiske machine learning løsninger




Det får du med i købet

Vi er jo et ecommerce-hus, så vi kan ikke dy os fra at smide lidt ekstra godter ned i din kurv:




0 chefer, 150 kollegaer. Her er der ingen, der bestemmer, hvordan du skal arbejde. Vi har sat beslutningerne fri, så dem der har faglighed og kompetence selv bestemmer, hvordan de løser opgaverne. Det betyder, at du og dit team får mulighed for at indrette jeres arbejde, sådan som I mener, det er bedst.




Gennemsigtighed er en af kerneværdierne i Vertica, og derfor ligger vores personalehåndbog frit tilgængeligt her. I personalehåndbogen kan du læse, hvilke vilkår vi - og alle vores fremtidige kolleger - arbejder under. Hvis ikke du har tid til at læse hele håndbogen igennem, så har vi fremhævet nogle af dem, vi sætter særligt pris på.




Livslang læring: Vi går i livets skole, men af og til er der også kurser, konferencer eller uddannelser, som man kan lære af. Er der noget, du gerne vil blive klogere på, har du muligheden for at videreuddanne dig i Vertica. Vi har intet loft på uddannelsesbudgettet, så der heller ikke er loft på læringen.




Det sociale: Vi holder af sociale arrangementer, og vi holder mange af dem. Det kan være alt fra klatring, padeltennis, byg-dit-eget-tastatur og cocktail-kursus til familietur i Djurs Sommerland. Derudover tager vi hvert år på en firmaweekend, hvor vi har fokus på hygge, god mad og socialt samvær.




Hele mennesker på arbejde: Vi tror på at der er andet i livet end arbejde og derfor er det vigtigt for os, at vi holder os inden for en 37-timers arbejdsuge, og at vi behandler hinanden med stor ordentlighed og respekt




Kan du se dig selv som en del af Vertica?

Lyder dette som dit næste skridt i din karriere? Så send din ansøgning og CV hurtigst muligt. Vi er klar over, at det er umuligt at give et fuldstændigt og retvisende billede af dig selv ud fra en ansøgning og CV alene, men indledningsvist er det desværre alt, vi har. Vi vil gerne lære personen bag ansøgningen så godt at kende som muligt. Fortæl os derfor om din passion og dine værdier. Hvis du vil høre mere om stillingen, så skriv eller ring til Sara Stefansen på sst@vertica.dk eller +45 22 15 44 06

Show more
HTML:
Machine Learning Engineer

Motiveres du af at have en alsidig og spændende arbejdsgang, hvor du kan fordybe dig i Python kodning og implementering af machine learning modeller og mange andre spændende arbejdsopgaver, som du selv kan være med til at præge? Så kom og bring dine kompetencer i spil som vores nye Machine Learning Engineer til Vertica i Aarhus!


”Verti-hvem?”

Måske du har hørt om os? Måske ikke? Uanset hvad får du en lille intro her.

Hos Vertica bygger vi ecommerce. Det har vi gjort i mere end 20 år, og vi gør det sammen med nogle af landets førende virksomheder. Blandt vores kunder finder du Hørkram, Søstrene Grene, Molslinjen, Kvadrat, Brødrene Dahl og mange andre. Fælles for dem er, at de har et stort fokus på den brugerflade, som kunden møder, og det er her, vi hos Vertica kommer ind i billedet. For et års tid siden bredte vi vores ekspertise yderligere ud og startede vores AI og Data team, som arbejder på at hjælpe vores kunder med optimeringer ved hjælpe af AI og data drevne løsninger.


Du vil blive en del af vores nyetablerede AI og Data team, som består af kollegaer med forskellige baggrunde, hvor det som binder jer sammen, er jeres store interesse og faglighed indenfor data, AI og forretningsudvikling. Sammen sikrer I, hvordan I kan hjælpe vores kunder med at omsætte data til vigtige indsigter, som kan være med til at flytte og styrke deres forretning.


Da du er den første i denne specifikke rolle, vil du derfor have rig mulighed for sætte dit præg på, hvordan rollen skal udvikle sig, samt være med til at definere dine arbejdsopgaver. Men herunder er vores bud på, hvad du vil bruge en stor del af din tid på.


Dine opgaver bliver blandt andet:

  • Designe, bygge og levere værdiskabende ai-løsninger til en bred række af kunder i samarbejde med resten af AI og Data teamet.
  • Implementering af machine learning modeller: Samarbejde med vores Data Scientist for at bringe maskinlæringsmodeller fra udvikling til produktion samt sikre høj kvalitet, skalerbarhed og en stabil deployment-proces
  • Designe og implementerer MLOps workflows til at sikre en effektiv overgang fra Proof of Concept (poc) til produktion
  • Opsætte systemer til modelmonitorering, som muliggør løbende overvågning af modeller i produktion
  • Være med til at finde de bedste løsninger baseret på kundernes ønsker og behov


Vi forestiller os, at du har nedenstående kvalifikationer, men lige så̊ vigtigt er det, at du har lyst til at udvikle dig sammen med os og drive vores forretning mod nye højder


Vi søger dig, som har minimum 3 års relevant erhvervserfaring samt har et solidt teknisk grundlag og evnerne og forståelsen for at drive processer fra start til slut. Det er et plus, hvis du har erfaring med hele machine learning lifecycle.


Du har erfaring som konsulent og motiveres af at arbejde med AI projekter samt hjælpe kunder med at finde den bedste løsning til deres udfordringer


  • Du har erfaring med at sætte machine learning modeller i produktion
  • Du har stærke færdigheder og god erfaring med Python
  • Du har erfaring med MLOps (machine learning operations)
  • Du har flair og interesse for at arbejde med en bred vifte af AI løsninger herunder både generativ AI og klassiske machine learning løsninger

0 chefer, 150 kollegaer. Her er der ingen, der bestemmer, hvordan du skal arbejde. Vi har sat beslutningerne fri, så dem der har faglighed og kompetence selv bestemmer, hvordan de løser opgaverne. Er der noget, du gerne vil blive klogere på, har du muligheden for at videreuddanne dig i Vertica. Vi har intet loft på uddannelsesbudgettet, så der heller ikke er loft på læringen.

Derudover tager vi hvert år på en firmaweekend, hvor vi har fokus på hygge, god mad og socialt samvær.

Title: Machine Learning/AI konsulenter
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Er du konsulent med erfaring i Machine Learning/AI, og er du bosiddende i Danmark, med minimum 5 års professionel erfaring fra IT relaterede projekter ude hos kunder, og har du ikke før haft kontakt med os, så kunne et partnerskab med emagine måske være interessant for dig?

emagine er et high-end konsulenthus med hovedkvarter i København, der leverer skræddersyede ydelser og ekspertise ved brug af et netværk af ekspertkonsulenter.

Som freelance konsulent kan du blive inddraget i opgaver, enten som ekspertrådgiver, som en del af et emagine team, eller som en betroet konsulent ude på opgave i en af vores kunders organisation.

I Danmark har vi kontorer i København, Aarhus og Aalborg, med over 900 konsulenter ude på opgaver lige nu. I Europa har vi over 5.000 konsulenter på opgave.

Tilmeld dig vores database og få muligheden for at arbejde med nogle af de mest innovative virksomheder i branchen.

At blive medlem af vores konsulentdatabase har mange fordele, herunder:


Adgang til en bred vifte af projekter med internationale virksomheder, så du kan anvende dine færdigheder og ekspertise til projekter, der betyder noget.
Opgaver, der matcher dine færdigheder og ekspertise, hvilket sikrer, at du arbejder på projekter, der stemmer overens med dine styrker.
Kurser og kompetenceudvikling på alle niveauer med særlig erfaring inden for undervisning i projekt- program- og porteføljeledelse.
Muligheder for at udvide din portefølje af projekter og fremme din karriere


Som konsulent med Machine Learning/AI kompetencer, bør du have erfaring med en del af følgende:


Artifical Intelligence (AI)
Machine Learning (ML)
Retrieval-augmented generation (RAG)
Python
Deep Learning
SQL
Neurale Netværk
Large Language Model (LLM)
Microsoft Azure AI Studio
AutoGen
Docker
R
Algoritmer
NLP Engineering
Kubernetes

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
KAYAK, part of Booking Holdings (NASDAQ: BKNG), is the world’s leading travel search engine. With billions of queries across our platforms, we help people find their perfect flight, stay, rental car and vacation package. We’re also transforming business travel with a new corporate travel solution, KAYAK for Business.

As an employee of KAYAK, you will be part of a travel company that operates a portfolio of global metasearch brands including momondo, Cheapflights and HotelsCombined, among others. From start-up to industry leader, innovation is in our DNA and every employee has an opportunity to make their mark. Our focus is on building the best travel search engine to make it easier for everyone to experience the world.

The Marketing Measurement team's mission is to improve KAYAK's ability to measure the efficiency of marketing efforts. This role works closely with marketing leaders to make better data-informed strategic marketing decisions.

As a Senior Data Scientist on this team, you will have the opportunity to develop the frameworks and roadmaps to tackle marketing measurement challenges in an efficient way, work with the stakeholders to align on priorities, and closely work your team to build the robust measurement and experimentation solutions!

In this role, you will:



Manage into end to end experimentation from formulating hypotheses, experiment design to collecting right data, doing power analysis to finally then implementing and analyzing experiment results
Support in the initiatives towards building a robust framework for efficiently creating and evaluating creative, bidding and landing page experiments
Develop new models and advanced analytics techniques to measure and optimize the marketing spend in a robust manner
Support the development of less senior scientists, collaborates with team members to assure timely delivery of high-quality work
Build standardized and scalable solutions, and lead from front in setting up the best practices



Please apply if you have:



Advanced degree (Masters, PhD) in Data Science, Statistics or a related field.
Extensive experience with data manipulation and extraction using relational databases (SQL)
Ability to write high quality, scalable, maintainable code (Python, R)
Strong story-telling and presentation skills to understand and communicate in the language of business partners, mostly within Marketing
Strong foundation in experimentation methods and causal inference techniques
Experienced in marketing science measurement methodologies like Causal impact, geo-lift on Google, and Marketing mix models
Proactive work style, needing minimal guidance and demonstrating good judgment
Has a keen sense of success criteria and demonstrates success through end-to-end QA. Independently adheres to strong testing and validation principles
Passionate about large data sets in marketing, finance, and economics. Skilled in paid marketing data, time-series analysis, econometrics, and regression models



Benefits:



Work from (almost) anywhere for up to 20 days per year
Focus on mental health and well-being:

Company-paid therapy sessions through SpringHealth
Company-paid subscription to HeadSpace
Company-wide week off a year - the whole team fully recharges (and returns without a pile-up of work!)
No meeting Fridays

Paid parental leave
Generous paid vacation + time off for your birthday
Paid volunteer time
Focus on your career growth:

Development Dollars
Leadership development
Access to thousand of on-demand e-learnings

Travel Discounts
Employee Resource Groups
6 weeks paid vacation
Pension plan contributions
Private health & life insurance
Lunch provided five days per week & breakfast once a week
Professional espresso machine
Awesome office in the city centre of Copenhagen
Monthly social events, yoga, Thursday bars


Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

At OpenTable/KAYAK, we aspire to be a workplace that fosters inclusion and reflects the diverse communities we serve. Hiring people with different backgrounds and perspectives is critical to innovation and to how we deliver great experiences for our users, partners, and teams. We strive to be an open and welcoming environment so that no matter who you are, you can be yourself.

We ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform job responsibilities, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation(s).

Title: Data Scientist, Lystrup
Description:
Do you want to push the boundaries of AI and Machine Learning, building intelligent solutions that make a real impact for the Defense Industry?




Terma is at the forefront of an exciting journey, marked by growth, innovation, and the delivery of mission-critical solutions for the defense and aerospace industries. Our technologies provide safety and security for people on land, at sea, and in the air. In space, we contribute to pioneering missions that address emerging global challenges.




To support this mission, we are seeking a Data Scientist to join our Advanced Analytics team. This is more than just a job – it’s an opportunity to shape the future of defense technology and contribute to a safer world.




Your role in our team




Since early 2022, the global security landscape has evolved rapidly. Denmark, together with its NATO allies, is facing increasing challenges that demand innovative solutions. In this dynamic environment, the ability to deliver cutting-edge technology swiftly is essential. At Terma’s Advanced Analytics team, we develop and maintain AI-driven solutions that support decision-making and enhance situational awareness.




We are a passionate and dedicated team that takes full ownership of our AI products – from ideation to delivery and maintenance. Our work goes beyond coding; we collaborate closely with our customers to understand their needs, ensuring that our solutions make a real impact. This means you will engage directly with end users, gaining insights that go far beyond the traditional developer role.




You will be part of a team that values innovation, diversity, and psychological safety. We support and challenge each other, fostering an environment where everyone can thrive and contribute to meaningful solutions.




How you will make a meaningful contribution




As a Data Scientist at Terma, you will:

Develop advanced AI solutions – Work with sometimes large and sometimes small amount of data, leveraging deep learning models to push the boundaries of what’s possible.
Take ownership for data and AI modeling for key projects – Take responsibility for AI solutions that address real-world challenges in multi-domain operations (maritime, land, air, space, and cyberspace).
Ensure top-tier quality and security – You’ll be handling classified information and mission-critical systems, requiring both innovation and adherence to military-grade security standards.
Collaborate and engage with end users – Your work will directly impact defense operations, so understanding real-world applications is crucial.




This role is perfect for someone who is eager to take on responsibility, think outside the box, and be part of a team that values both skill and dedication.




Bring your world class expertise into play




Mindset and Team Culture:

You believe in teamwork and thrive in an environment built on mutual trust and collaboration.
You take ownership of your work, embracing challenges with a problem-solving mindset.
You are motivated by the impact of your work and excited about developing solutions that truly matter.
You enjoy an informal but professional work culture where ideas are shared, and learning is continuous.




Education & Experience:

A degree in Engineering, Physics, Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent work experience).
Strong technical skills, including proficiency in statistical analysis, machine learning algorithms, and AI/ML frameworks such as TensorFlow or PyTorch.
Experience with AI/ML deployment, programming (Python), data manipulation, and visualization tools.
Familiarity with Linux environments and containerization tools such as Docker.




Most importantly, we value passion and creativity – if you have funny hobby projects or unique experiences, we want to hear about them!




At Terma, you will be part of a company that not only pushes technological boundaries but also values its people. We are committed to creating an inclusive workplace where everyone feels valued and empowered to contribute. If you are ready to take on exciting challenges, grow professionally, and be part of a team that makes a difference, we encourage you to apply.

Let’s build the future of defense technology together!

__________________________________________________________________________________




Benefits at Terma

At Terma, we prioritize the well-being of our employees, ensuring they are well taken care of. Joining our team comes with a multitude of perks designed to enhance your social life, cultural experiences, and health.

Development Opportunities: Benefit from a personalized development plan, access to our e-learning program, and specific career courses.

International Environment: Explore career opportunities with colleagues around the world.

Flexible Working Hours: Enjoy the opportunity to work flexible and the option to work from home up to two days per week. Internet connection at home is paid by Terma.

Comprehensive Benefits Package: Receive a 10% paid pension along with a beneficial health care and insurance package. Enjoy discounts from various business partners.

Well-being Perks: Opportunity to enroll in our on-site massage-offer

Social and Professional Events: Participate in various events including sports and talks, and join our book club, bicycle club, student network, wine club, motorcycle club, and more.

Competence networking across professional experts in Terma: Professional presentations and knowledge sharing across the organization

Convenient Locations: You can work from any of our locations in Lystrup, Søborg or Grenaa, if your tasks permit

__________________________________________________________________________________




We encourage all individuals to apply for our job openings, as we are dedicated to fostering a diverse, equitable, inclusive, and welcoming workplace. Our commitment to these DEIB principles means we value and celebrate the unique backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences of each team member. We strive to ensure that every employee has equal opportunities to succeed, feels respected and valued, and experiences a strong sense of belonging within our organization.

We encourage you to leave out photo, age, and name.

We do not expect you to write an application, but please send us a motivated resume. To ensure that your application will reach us and is properly processed, we only accept applications via www.terma.com. Applications will be processed continuously.

__________________________________________________________________________________




Any unanswered questions?

Feel free to contact Hiring Manager on this e-mail: MJLA@terma.com in case of any further questions regarding this position.




Bear in mind that candidates for this position must be able to obtain a security clearance by the Danish Defense Intelligence Service. This entails that candidate, as a minimum, have stayed within NATO/EU for the last 7 years only interrupted by short stays abroad.




The Denmark based high-tech Terma Group develops products and systems for defense and non-defense security applications, including command and control systems, radar systems, self-protection systems for aircraft, space technology, and aerostructures for the aircraft industry. TERMA | Allies in innovation

Show more

  • You believe in teamwork and thrive in an environment built on mutual trust and collaboration.
  • You take ownership of your work, embracing challenges with a problem-solving mindset.
  • You are motivated by the impact of your work and excited about developing solutions that truly matter.
  • You enjoy an informal but professional work culture where ideas are shared, and learning is continuous.


Education & Experience:

  • A degree in Engineering, Physics, Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent work experience).
  • Strong technical skills, including proficiency in statistical analysis, machine learning algorithms, and AI/ML frameworks such as TensorFlow or PyTorch.
  • Experience with AI/ML deployment, programming (Python), data manipulation, and visualization tools.
  • Familiarity with Linux environments and containerization tools such as Docker.


Most importantly, we value passion and creativity – if you have funny hobby projects or unique experiences, we want to hear about them!


At Terma, you will be part of a company that not only pushes technological boundaries but also values its people. We are committed to creating an inclusive workplace where everyone feels valued and empowered to contribute. If you are ready to take on exciting challenges, grow professionally, and be part of a team that makes a difference, we encourage you to apply.

Let’s build the future of defense technology together!

__________________________________________________________________________________


Benefits at Terma

At Terma, we prioritize the well-being of our employees, ensuring they are well taken care of. Joining our team comes with a multitude of perks designed to enhance your social life, cultural experiences, and health.

Development Opportunities: Benefit from a personalized development plan, access to our e-learning program, and specific career courses.

International Environment: Explore career opportunities with colleagues around the world.

Flexible Working Hours: Enjoy the opportunity to work flexible and the option to work from home up to two days per week. Internet connection at home is paid by Terma.

Comprehensive Benefits Package: Receive a 10% paid pension along with a beneficial health care and insurance package. Enjoy discounts from various business partners.

Well-being Perks: Opportunity to enroll in our on-site massage-offer

Social and Professional Events: Participate in various events including sports and talks, and join our book club, bicycle club, student network, wine club, motorcycle club, and more.

Competence networking across professional experts in Terma: Professional presentations and knowledge sharing across the organization

Convenient Locations: You can work from any of our locations in Lystrup, Søborg or Grenaa, if your tasks permit

__________________________________________________________________________________


We encourage all individuals to apply for our job openings, as we are dedicated to fostering a diverse, equitable, inclusive, and welcoming workplace. Our commitment to these DEIB principles means we value and celebrate the unique backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences of each team member. We strive to ensure that every employee has equal opportunities to succeed, feels respected and valued, and experiences a strong sense of belonging within our organization.

We encourage you to leave out photo, age, and name.

We do not expect you to write an application, but please send us a motivated resume. To ensure that your application will reach us and is properly processed, we only accept applications via www.terma.com. Applications will be processed continuously.

__________________________________________________________________________________


Any unanswered questions?

Feel free to contact Hiring Manager on this e-mail: MJLA@terma.com in case of any further questions regarding this position.


Bear in mind that candidates for this position must be able to obtain a security clearance by the Danish Defense Intelligence Service. This entails that candidate, as a minimum, have stayed within NATO/EU for the last 7 years only interrupted by short stays abroad.


The Denmark based high-tech Terma Group develops products and systems for defense and non-defense security applications, including command and control systems, radar systems, self-protection systems for aircraft, space technology, and aerostructures for the aircraft industry. TERMA | Allies in innovation

Title: Data Science Intern
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
SYBO is part of the Miniclip family and known for the widely popular game, Subway Surfers - the most downloaded mobile game in the world, with over four billion downloads. Located in the heart of Copenhagen, we aim to create playful moments that inspire our fans to care.

We are looking for a talented Data Science Intern to join our Analytics team for 3 to 6 months. During this time, you will get the chance to dive into the exciting world of mobile gaming, to help us enhance our data understanding and innovate within our team.

If you are passionate about data, proactive and have a problem-solving mindset, we would love to have you onboard.

This internship is unpaid and full-time running for the fall semester in 2025.

Your time at SYBO

In your ramp-up month - During this time, you will get the opportunity to experience being part of a real analytics team and your first step will be discovering the gaming industry, SYBO and how our analytics team operates.

In your contributor months - After this discovery period, you will be working a comprehensive investigation into a real gaming data problem with the help of the team. With this project, you will get the opportunity to enhance the game knowledge and provide concrete inputs on how to improve it.

Responsibilities


Your role will lie in applying your analytical skills & creativity to large datasets.
You will be looking for optimisations to contribute to the game performance.
You will get the freedom to propose new ideas, and present them to stakeholders within the company.


Requirements


Experience in a programming language such as Python or R Studio, as well as basics in SQL
Experience with data handling (data collection, cleaning, autonomous exploration etc.)
Understanding of statistical analysis


It is a requirement to be enrolled in a university program that supports a full-time internship as part of the education - and you need to be able to commute to our Copenhagen office on a daily basis.

We do not offer relocation, VISA, or house search assistance for internships.

About SYBO

We're SYBO, the mobile games studio behind the legendary Subway Surfers, with over 4 billion downloads worldwide! Join our team in the heart of Copenhagen, where creativity flourishes in our new, innovative studio.

If you join us, you'll have the opportunity to dive into engaging and creative projects alongside a diverse group of collaborative colleagues from over 40 countries across the globe.

We truly believe you perform your best, when you have the equipment you need - and our IT team is always there to ensure you have access to the latest tools and the right gear, enabling you to be at your best.

We also pride ourselves in taking care of your well-being, offering a delicious lunch buffet, a variety of healthy snacks, and regular social events to keep the energy flowing.

SYBO is committed to providing equal opportunities to all applicants, regardless of race, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

Title: Machine Learning Researcher
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Imagine working with cutting-edge machine learning models, crunching high frequency data sets and sparring with exceptional and fun colleagues, all while taking part in scaling our business even further.

Does this sound highly appealing to you? Then you might be our new Machine Learning Researcher at Alipes Capital.




At Alipes Capital, we have been the market leader in automating the financial markets since we started back in 2008, shaping a fully automatic natural language processing system for reading and interpreting financial news.




To accomplish our mission of being the best at what we do, we understand the importance of elevating our predictive modeling standards to the highest levels. Your work will involve leading the efforts in creating a world class modeling workflow, enabling the team to seamlessly turn massive data sets of financial information into mathematical models that accurately predict movements in the financial markets.




In doing so, you will get a chance to tackle a variety of software infrastructure challenges, such as:

Development and optimization of calibration and benchmarking frameworks
Building out and implementing best practices for data preparation and dataset generation pipelines
Prototyping and releasing novel predictive architectures, especially with respect to time-series models.




You will get instant validation of your work and experience short feedback cycles, where going from inception to deployment can be a matter of hours. There will be no red tape to cut and no sales people to consult.




About the team

All of this will happen in an informal atmosphere where technical discussions are valued, and you are encouraged to take ownership of, and pride in, your work. You will impact the direction of the team, prioritize your work and choose the tools that get the job done. We are a tight-knit modeling team with fourteen passionate quantitative researchers covering 6 nationalities – eleven PhD’s and three MSc’s with expertise in statistical analysis, mathematical modeling and machine learning. We enjoy collaboration and are always willing to lend a helping hand. We are working alongside two other teams of software developers and traders that implement and conceive the mathematical models together with us. What makes this constellation work great is that all of the individual team members write code and understand that a seemingly trivial change can actually require a lot of work, and vice versa.




About you

Fluency within mathematics and statistics
Experience working with the full Machine Learning stack from data generation through model calibration and real-life validation and monitoring
Programming experience with Python, in particular data-wrangling and numerical programming
Proficiency with computer science fundamentals
A scientific and inquisitive mind




Nice to have

Experience working with ‘out-of-core’ datasets
Experience working with tools like PyTorch, Tensorflow, XGBoost and/or Catboost
Programming experience with languages like C# and C/C++
PhD or MSc degree in engineering, physics, computer science, mathematics or economics




What we can offer you

Flat hierarchy and high levels of trust and autonomy
Exciting problems to solve
Collaborative team made up of really smart and curious people
Nice office in central Copenhagen with a hybrid work model
Pension, Health Insurance and 30 days of vacation




Practicalities

To apply, please send us your CV and a cover letter telling us why you think this role is a great fit for you. If your profile looks like a good match, we will get in touch to coordinate an online technical test as a first step in the interview process.

Title: Senior Data Science Specialist
Description:
Senior Data Science Specialist:




Do you want to be a member of an international, skilled, highly motivated and self-driven team of software developers and data scientists spanning different educational backgrounds and competences?










This team is the innovation center for an global market leader where innovation is not only welcomed but encouraged!




We are the competence center for data-driven and vision-based solutions, providing production insights and predictions by applying machine learning techniques to discrete data and vision data from production sites. These innovative solutions focus on bringing added value to the production by optimizing processes, reducing cost and not least by reducing environmental footprint.










We are now looking for a senior data science specialist to help us continue in our data-driven development. With a well structured data platform you will become a subject matter expert for all things data.




Taking a holistic approach to the Data lake and offering advanced analysis by finding correlations and trends that we can leverage towards new products. Sitting at the centre of the data value chain, you will be linked with stakeholders as well as like minded IT professionals.










What can you expect?




* An innovation driven tech team that work in a collaborative and dynamic environment

* Well defined tech stack that supports data-driven decision making

* A direct line of communication with senior management

* A focus on a healthy work-life balance

* Competitive salary and pension scheme










What do we expect?




* Previous experience with applied data science and machine learning

* Confidence with Python and SQL - Other programming languages are also welcome

* Experience translating business strategy into practical data development

* Ability to work as an individual or as a team member

* Ability to be in the office to help add to our team culture










This is a company I have personally worked with on multiple occasions, with great success!




If you want to learn more please don't hesitate to apply!

Title: Machine Learning Weather Researcher
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Imagine working with cutting-edge machine learning models, crunching high frequency data sets and sparring with exceptional and fun colleagues, all while taking part in scaling our business even further. Does this sound highly appealing to you?

Then you might be our new Machine Learning (ML) Weather Researcher at Alipes Capital.




About the Role

Alipes began trading in the Energy sector in 2022. We use machine learning technology for reading and interpreting fundamental and market data and execute our trading strategies based on this data. Since our inception in 2008, we have continuously grown and diversified into new business areas driven by our technology. Alipes aims to support liquid power markets and free flow of energy, which are crucial to facilitate the transition from fossil fuels to renewable energy sources, thereby promoting a sustainable future.




Forecasting power generation from renewables is crucial for price discovery, risk management and for balancing the power grid. Recent advances in ML/AI/Neural based weather modeling promise models which are orders of magnitude faster to run than traditional physics-based numerical weather models.




Your work as our new ML Weather Researcher will involve turning massive data sets of weather data into machine learning models that accurately predict short-term weather patterns and power production from renewables.




You will get instant validation of your work and experience short feedback cycles, where going from inception to deployment can be a matter of hours. There will be no red tape to cut and no sales people to consult. We are centrally located in Copenhagen and have 55 bright and ambitious team members.




About the Team

All of this will happen in an informal atmosphere where technical discussions are valued, and you are encouraged to take ownership of, and pride in, your work. You will impact the direction of the team, prioritize your work and choose the tools that get the job done. We are a tight-knit modeling team with passionate quantitative analysts covering 6 nationalities – a combination of PhD’s and MSc’s with expertise in statistical analysis, mathematical modeling and machine learning. We enjoy collaboration and are always willing to lend a helping hand. We are working alongside two other teams of software developers and economists that implement and conceive the mathematical models together with us. What makes this constellation work great is that all of the individual team members write code and understand that a seemingly trivial change can actually require a lot of work, and vice versa.




About You

Experience with ML/AI/Neural-based weather forecasting (GraphCast etc)
Experience with Deep Learning and Neural Networks
PhD or MSc degree in engineering, physics, computer science or relevant field
Familiar with terms like ECMWF IFS, HRRR, GFS, GOES etc.
Proficiency within computer science fundamentals, mathematics and statistics
Programming experience with Python, in particular data-wrangling and numerical programming
A scientific and inquisitive mind




What we can Offer You

Flat hierarchy and high levels of trust and autonomy
Exciting problems to solve
Collaborative team made up of really smart and curious people
Nice office in central Copenhagen with a hybrid work model
Pension, Health Insurance and 30 days of vacation




Practicalities

To apply, please send us your CV and a cover letter telling us why you think this role is a great fit for you. If your profile looks like a good match, we will get in touch to coordinate an online technical test as a first step in the interview process.

Show more

Title: Junior Software Developer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We're Catalysta, a SaaS solution helping organizations track, report, and reduce their greenhouse gas emissions. Our platform is based on first-hand learnings from 100+ GHG accounting projects and 20.000+ hours of work.

We raised a pre-seed round in November, onboarded Senior Developers and Head of UX through December and January, and have a pipeline of potential customers. We're now looking for a talented individual to help accelerate our pace of development and join us on our mission to make sustainability impact more transparent and actionable.

You will be working closely with the rest of the founding team to create a great product experience. 2025 is the year we will be launching our product and our focus now is on building the MVP.

This is a full-stack developer role but with emphasis on front-end. We build our platform in Django and our front-end is based on HTML templating, Bootstrap, and HTMX.

The role is based in central Copenhagen near Nørreport Station, and please note that we work from the office with some remote work flexibility. We collaborate closely in the team and discuss challenges as they come up. We share office space with the leading sustainability consultancy in the Nordics.

Responsibilities


Architecture & Development: Participate in the overall architectural decisions and implementation of the Catalysta platform.
Technology Selection: Drive the selection of appropriate technologies, frameworks, and tools for the application’s development, deployment, and scaling.
Collaboration: Work closely with the developer team to translate business needs into technical solutions, ensuring the development process aligns with the long-term goals of the company.
Quality Assurance: Ensuring security and maintaining high standards of quality are crucial in this domain. We believe in achieving this through continuous, small improvements, quick user feedback, and thorough testing. We expect that you embody these principles.

Title: Senior Data Scientist for Stress Testing the Credit Portfolio Losses
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Join our collaborative team driving the Stress test calculations on loan losses at Danske Bank. We are responsible for maintaining and operating a suite of models utilized by several departments across the bank.

A key aspect of the role is the ability to aggregate and present model outputs in a clear and understandable manner. Our team also supports the strategic risk steering of the bank through quantitative analysis, including setting risk tolerance levels to protect the bank against severe losses and conducting ‘what if’ analyses such as scenarios involving the return of inflation, increasing interest rates, and decreasing house prices.

You will join a friendly team of eight data scientists with diverse quantitative backgrounds. Half of the team is based in Copenhagen, while the other half works from Vilnius..

"Depending on your experience and knowledge, we may offer you different seniority of the role.

You will:


Co-own the continuous development and optimization of the bank’s stress test models in Python
Engage with stakeholders and continuously improve the understanding and presentation of model outputs
Deliver input to the dialogue with the bank's auditors, model validators, external audit, and regulatory authorities


The tasks of the team are varied and model-centric, and we value the diverse skills each team member brings. If you are passionate about data science and are ready to embark on your career with us, we encourage you to apply.

About you:


Proficiency in Python
Experience in presenting and visualizing complex data to stakeholders
Experience in working with Amazon Web Services (AWS) cloud-based setups
A solid quantitative background
Proactive mindset with great collaboration and communication skills
Analytical skills with the ability to communicate technical information in a non-technical and concise manner
Banking experience is welcome but not essential; however, a genuine interest in exploring the fascinating world of banking is expected
Experience in building and operating models is highly valued


“We invite candidates with a degree in a quantitative field to apply, even if you do not meet every skill listed. Your enthusiasm and potential could be exactly what we need.”

We offer:

This position can be located both in Lithuania and Denmark. If you are hired in Lithuania, the applicable salary range will be from 3280 to 4920 EUR monthly (based on your competencies relevant for the job)

Additionally, each Danske Bank employee receives employee benefits package which includes:


Growth opportunities: professional & supportive team, e-learnings, numerous development programs; (incl. professional certificates); 100+ professions for internal mobility opportunities.
Health & Well-being: a diverse, inclusive, work & life balance work environment; additional health insurance; mental well-being practices; partial psychologist counselling compensation; silence and sleep zones at the office; game rooms.
Hybrid working conditions: Work from home up to two days a week; home office budget (after the probation period); modern Danske Campus workplace developed with anthropologist for the best employee experience.
Additional days of leave: for rest, health, volunteering, exams in higher education institutions, and other important activities. Moreover, for seniority with Danske Bank.
Monetary compensation package: accidents & critical diseases insurance; financial support in case of unfortunate events, travel insurance; III rd Pillar Pension Fund contribution.


See all the benefits HERE.

Your title in job contract will be Data Scientist, Senior.

Feel free to contact me @LinkedIn if you have any questions! Lars Thejls Aagaard, Head of Portfolio Intelligence, FVP at Danske Bank

#LT

About Us

Danske Bank is a Nordic bank with bridges to the world around us. For 150 years, we have supported people and businesses in releasing their potential. A career with us is an opportunity to join a community of 22,000 colleagues in a culture where we are committed to Teaming Up, Owning It and Being Open. Together, we are on a journey to transform Danske Bank into a better bank. For our customers, our employees and the societies around us.

Our team also supports the strategic risk steering of the bank through quantitative analysis, including setting risk tolerance levels to protect the bank against severe losses and conducting ‘what if’ analyses such as scenarios involving the return of inflation, increasing interest rates, and decreasing house prices.

You will join a friendly team of eight data scientists with diverse quantitative backgrounds. Half of the team is based in Copenhagen, while the other half works from Vilnius..

"Depending on your experience and knowledge, we may offer you different seniority of the role.

You will:

  • Co-own the continuous development and optimization of the bank’s stress test models in Python
  • Engage with stakeholders and continuously improve the understanding and presentation of model outputs
  • Deliver input to the dialogue with the bank's auditors, model validators, external audit, and regulatory authorities

The tasks of the team are varied and model-centric, and we value the diverse skills each team member brings. If you are passionate about data science and are ready to embark on your career with us, we encourage you to apply.

About you:

  • Proficiency in Python
  • Experience in presenting and visualizing complex data to stakeholders
  • Experience in working with Amazon Web Services (AWS) cloud-based setups
  • A solid quantitative background
  • Proactive mindset with great collaboration and communication skills
  • Analytical skills with the ability to communicate technical information in a non-technical and concise manner
  • Banking experience is welcome but not essential; however, a genuine interest in exploring the fascinating world of banking is expected
  • Experience in building and operating models is highly valued

“We invite candidates with a degree in a quantitative field to apply, even if you do not meet every skill listed. Your enthusiasm and potential could be exactly what we need.”

We offer:

This position can be located both in Lithuania and Denmark. If you are hired in Lithuania, the applicable salary range will be from 3280 to 4920 EUR monthly (based on your competencies relevant for the job)

Additionally, each Danske Bank employee receives employee benefits package which includes:

  • Growth opportunities: professional & supportive team, e-learnings, numerous development programs; (incl. professional certificates); 100+ professions for internal mobility opportunities.
  • Health & Well-being: a diverse, inclusive, work & life balance work environment; additional health insurance; mental well-being practices; partial psychologist counselling compensation; silence and sleep zones at the office; game rooms.
  • Hybrid working conditions: Work from home up to two days a week; home office budget (after the probation period); modern Danske Campus workplace developed with anthropologist for the best employee experience.
  • Additional days of leave: for rest, health, volunteering, exams in higher education institutions, and other important activities. Moreover, for seniority with Danske Bank.
  • Monetary compensation package: accidents & critical diseases insurance; financial support in case of unfortunate events, travel insurance; III rd Pillar Pension Fund contribution.

See all the benefits HERE.

Your title in job contract will be Data Scientist, Senior.

Feel free to contact me @LinkedIn if you have any questions! Lars Thejls Aagaard, Head of Portfolio Intelligence, FVP at Danske Bank

#LT

About Us

Danske Bank is a Nordic bank with bridges to the world around us. For 150 years, we have supported people and businesses in releasing their potential. A career with us is an opportunity to join a community of 22,000 colleagues in a culture where we are committed to Teaming Up, Owning It and Being Open. Together, we are on a journey to transform Danske Bank into a better bank. For our customers, our employees and the societies around us.

Title: Data Scientist, Computer Vision
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to develop computer vision and machine learning solutions for closing the gap between plan and reality for large scale construction projects, with the goal of minimizing waste through digitalization?

Your new role

Bringing data from offices to the construction site using 3D BIM models has long been part of our core expertise here at Dalux. Now, as one of the next steps in our effort to digitalize the construction industry, we are working to bring data from the construction site back into the office using modern Computer Vision techniques.

As a Data Scientist in our Computer Vision section, you will develop and deploy deep learning models to improve the understanding, alignment and correspondence between 3D models of the construction site and video data gathered using our vSLAM system. As part of an R&D team, you will work on discovery of new solutions through research and rapid prototyping, and translating the findings into delivery of high quality solutions to complex computer vision problems.

Your background

We believe you…


Have a solid theoretical foundation from a degree in computer science, engineering, IT or similar.
Have a hands-on experience with software development using C++, Python or C#. It is important that you have reached solid coding standards and strive for continuous improvement.
Have a machine learning experience or trained in the area. Hands-on experience with PyTorch and MLFlow is a plus.
Have computer vision experience or trained in the area. Hands-on experience with OpenCV is a plus.
Can work both independently and as part of a team.


Most important is your problem-solving attitude, passion for software craftmanship, and the ambition to participate in the full lifecycle of our machine learning solutions.

Our tech...


C++
OpenGL
Python
PyTorch
MLFlow
Kubernetes


We are focused on using the right tools for the job, and as such the list of technologies may change depending on our needs and new offerings.

What To Expect As a Daluxian

In our organization the way from idea to product is short, combined with creative freedom and a high level of trust in your work, ensures that you will be able to create tangible value for our users.

You will become a part of a highly skilled team of passionate individuals driven by the wish to explore new and reshape existing technologies. As Dalux is a software company, we want half of the company to consist of Software Developers. All our software development happens at our head office at Vibenshuset in Copenhagen.

We offer...


Central location in Copenhagen, focus on work/life balance without any overtime, and no dress code.
An active social environment with monthly events and social clubs.
Flat communication in our organization, where the way from idea to product is short combined with creative freedom and a high level of trust in your work, ensures that you will be able to create tangible value for our users.
You’ll join a highly specialized, international team with room for creativity and professional growth.
Strong focus on diversity and inclusion – your ideas are heard, and opportunities are available to all.
Attractive employee benefits such as health insurance, lunch plan, coffee and fruit, free fitness facilities, and parking garage.
Focus on your development and well-being, with support for both professional goals and personal growth.


Ready for the next step

If Dalux sounds like a place where you could develop and contribute to the high-quality software, we would gladly accept your application. We will be having ongoing interviews.

If you have any questions, feel free to contact Simone Jena Berg Christensen.

Who Is Dalux

Dalux is a Danish software company founded in 2005 by Ph.D. Bent Dalgaard and Torben Dalgaard. Dalux’ products are aimed at making the construction industry smarter and more effective as it is the world’s 2nd largest industry and amongst the least digitalized. Our user-friendly digital tools and Building Information Modelling-technology (also known as BIM) is used in more than 160 countries globally.

We are crazy about cool technology and have experience being first movers on new tech. Our products are based on our unique 3D BIM-technology and makes use of AR - all developed entirely by Dalux.

Application deadline:

Ongoing

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Do you have a strategic and analytical mindset? Do you possess a proactive attitude and thrive in a dynamic environment? Do you fancy a career as a data scientist in Denmark’s largest retailer?

Then you might be our new colleague

We are looking for business minded colleagues to be part of our newly established Supply Chain Development team in Netto.

You and the team will have the responsibility of driving strategic projects across business units, namely Netto, føtex and Bilka, utilizing and processing the huge amount of data available in Salling Group leading to insights that enable more informed business decision-making creating a difference for our customers.

Your Tasks And Responsibilities


Through data analyses create insights to support core retail processes regarding e.g. product availability across stores and distribution centres
Together with the team, design, develop and implement tools and models that utilize the data to create business impact in new ways
Ensure efficient data availability including tailor-build tools
Support the general data-driven transformation across Salling Group
Drive step-change improvements to core forecasting and allocation IT infrastructure in close collaboration with internal and external stakeholders


Your Skills And Background

You have a Master’s degree within economics, IT, engineering or other natural science degrees (e.g. cand.scient, cand.oecon, cand.merc). Preferably, you have a couple of years’ of experience as a data scientist or in a similar role, where you have acquired the necessary skills to succeed as a data scientist.

Alternatively, you compensate for your lack of experience by being a top-performer and by having relevant experience in a student job during your studies. You have a natural interest in data and how it can be utilized to create business impact. Beside your passion for data, you have a strong business acumen enabling you to utilize the right data and making the best analysis for the problem at hand.

You have an analytical mindset, a structured way of working and is a real problem-solver. You have experience with extracting, cleaning and transforming data as well as data modelling creating measures and reports that support solid business decisions across Salling Group.

You have experience with programming/scripting languages such as R, Python, VBA, DAX and SQL.

As a person you are curious of nature and have an eagerness to take on a very steep learning-curve. You are proactive and have a ‘self-starter attitude’ and can independently focus, see opportunities and invite yourself to the table. As you will interact with many stakeholders in the organization, you must also have personal presence and the ability to present your points convincingly.

Fluency in Danish is a prerequisite.

We offer


An exciting career with a steep learning curve in an international company in continued growth, giving you extensive opportunity for both personal and professional growth
A diversified job with impact and responsibilities
Being part of a highly professional team in a dynamic environment offering you deep insights in retail
Competitive salary package and benefits


Are you the person for the job?

Send your application, resume and copy of your grades as soon as possible - and no later than 2 March 2025 – through the link on this page.

Please note that applications will be assessed on an ongoing basis and therefore the job application may close before the recruitment process is completed if we have proceeded with candidates to the screening or interview phase

Feel free to contact: Head of Supply Chain and Logistics, Nikolaj Holm Hansen, at +45 2363 9188 if you have further inquiries on the position.
Show more

Title: Natural Language Processing (NLP) Researcher
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to impact a highly-skilled team that uses cutting edge techniques in Natural Language Processing and Algorithmic Trading? We are looking for an NLP Researcher that will help us greatly improve the text-processing behind our models.




At Alipes Capital, we have been the market leader in automating the financial markets since we started back in 2008, shaping a fully automatic natural language processing system for reading and interpreting financial news.




Your work

Your work will support turning massive data sets of unstructured financial information into structured datasets and mathematical models that accurately predict movements in the equity markets. In doing so, you will:

Redesign and introduce new text-processing techniques to extract additional and more accurate entities from the text-sources that underlie our trading algorithms
Maintain and curate new and existing text data sources for our analyses
Automate monitoring and benchmarking of the trading strategies




You will enjoy a wide degree of autonomy and responsibility to optimize our machine-learning pipelines, from data-ingestion to live-model performance. There is no red tape, no sales people to consult and there is ample room for creativity.




The team

All of this will happen in an informal atmosphere where technical discussions are valued and you are encouraged to take ownership of, and pride in, your work. You will impact the direction of the team, prioritize your work and choose the tools that get the job done. We are a tight-knit modeling team with fourteen passionate quantitative researchers covering six nationalities – eleven PhD’s and three MSc’s- with expertise in statistical analysis, mathematical modeling and machine learning (seven of us working directly on the text-based equity models).




We enjoy collaboration, lending a helping hand and discussing the business cases built upon our data-sets. You will be working alongside a team of software developers and a team of traders who implement and conceive the trading models with us. All team members write code and are not afraid to discuss technical details.




Need to have

Skilled in extracting signals from texts using embeddings to enhance prediction model
Proficient in entity-extraction from text, e.g. using modern Transformer-based Large-Language Models
Solid understanding of machine learning techniques and their practical applications
Aptitude for programming in a numerical scripting language (we primarily use Python)
A meticulous and detail-oriented mind




Nice to have

Experience using RAGs (Retrieval-Augmentation-Generation)
Working with financial/trading data
Experience with C#, C/C++ or Java
Familiarity with software engineering (version control, unit testing, object oriented-design)
Degree in Computer Science / Engineering




What we can offer you

Flat hierarchy and high levels of trust and autonomy
Exciting problems to solve
Collaborative team made up of really smart and curious people
Nice office in central Copenhagen with a hybrid work model
Pension, Health Insurance and 30 days of vacation




Practicalities

To apply, please send us your CV and a cover letter telling us why you think this role is a great fit for you. In your cover letter, if applicable, please describe a project where you extracted structured or unstructured information from text - including the techniques, tools, models used and how those extractions informed further decisions/predictions.

If you're selected for an interview, we will be very interested in discussing technical details with you about this project!

Should your profile look like a good match, we will get in touch to coordinate an online technical test as a first step in the interview process.

Show more

Title: Senior Software Engineer
Place: Odense Kommune, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Senior .NET Engineer – Aviation Technology – Odense (Hybrid)




Are you an experienced .NET developer with a passion for complex algorithms and cutting-edge aviation technology? Join a market-leading company in Odense that specializes in advanced flight planning and tracking solutions for the global aviation industry.




About the Company

This company develops and enhances software that optimizes aircraft operations before, during, and after flights. Their technology powers in-flight planning, live tracking, and route optimization for over 450 airlines across 150 countries.




As a Senior .NET Engineer, you'll work on mission-critical systems that impact global aviation efficiency, collaborating with highly skilled developers in self-managed agile scrum teams.




Your Role

Develop, test, and maintain scalable backend applications using .NET/C#.
Implement RESTful APIs and web services to support frontend and third-party integrations.
Contribute to high-level technical discussions and system architecture.
Work on complex algorithms to build automated route planning solutions.




Tech Stack & Requirements

Strong experience with .NET (C#) and SQL.
Knowledge of TDD (Test-Driven Development) and best software practices.
Interest in algorithm development and optimization techniques.
Ability to work autonomously in agile teams.




What’s in It for You?

Hybrid working model – work from home and the office.
Career growth opportunities in a fast-growing, innovative company.
Perks: Internet, mobile plan, insurance, and a great canteen.
Unique bonus – Fly in the company plane or helicopter with friends & family! ✈️🚁




Interested?

Let’s have a confidential chat! Send me your contact number and the best time to call, and I’ll be in touch.

Title: Graduate Program 2025 - Data Science & Analytics
Place: Ballerup Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you looking to kick off your career journey?

Do you like the idea of joining the European PayTech?




If so, you are at the right place!




Our graduate program offers you the chance to create your unique career path within our diverse international team, operating in more than 25 countries. Rotate among different departments, learn from experienced professionals, and make a difference by working on real business cases.




About the program

Our Graduate Program is more than a learning path - it's a journey where you will work on real business cases and have a direct impact on business results.




What can you expect?

Permanent position in one of the business departments from the start of your employment.
Two rotations between different business departments during the 12-month program.
Project Management and Communication training path after the first six months.
Continuous learning and skill improvement through structured training sessions at our Digital PayTech University.
Opportunity to develop business ideas, implement them, and build your network of stakeholders within a group of highly skilled business leaders from all over Europe.




Exciting Opportunities in Data Science and Analytics

As part of our Data Science and Analytics team, you will contribute to data-driven decision-making in the Paytech industry. You'll work in positions such as Data Scientist, Data Engineer, and BI Data Engineer.




In this department, you'll analyse large datasets, transform data into insights, develop predictive models, and create data visualisations to support business strategies. This role offers the opportunity to work with cutting-edge tools and technologies, enhancing your analytical skills and significantly impacting our company's success.




As part of our selection process, the top candidates will be invited to participate in an exciting hackathon at our office location. This is a fantastic opportunity to showcase your skills, collaborate with peers, and potentially secure a spot on our team. Stay tuned for more details!




What makes you stand out as the ideal participant for this program?

If you see yourself in the description that follows, you should definitely take the first step and apply!

You have a master's degree in Engineering, STEM or Economics & Business, graduated within the last 12 months or will graduate in 2025.
You are a career starter with no more than one year of working experience.
You are fluent in English and in the local language of the country you are applying for (any additional language is beneficial).
You can easily imagine working in an international environment and actively collaborating with colleagues from all over Europe (if you have study or work-related international experience from abroad, that will be considered a beneficial qualification).
You are committed to your work, have an exciting university career with proven great results, enjoy learning new things, feel confident to own projects by yourself and like being part of a team.
For you, formal training is a starting point - you always look for more and want to make a difference in everything you work on.




Apply Now!

Don't miss out on this amazing opportunity. Apply today and discover what's in it for you!




We are committed to creating a diverse culture where talents from all walks of life can feel like they truly belong. By applying to our Graduate Program, you're one step closer to joining us.




We're excited to learn more about you!

Show more
