Title: Machine Learning Weather Researcher
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Imagine working with cutting-edge machine learning models, crunching high frequency data sets and sparring with exceptional and fun colleagues, all while taking part in scaling our business even further. Does this sound highly appealing to you?

Then you might be our new Machine Learning (ML) Weather Researcher at Alipes Capital.




About the Role

Alipes began trading in the Energy sector in 2022. We use machine learning technology for reading and interpreting fundamental and market data and execute our trading strategies based on this data. Since our inception in 2008, we have continuously grown and diversified into new business areas driven by our technology. Alipes aims to support liquid power markets and free flow of energy, which are crucial to facilitate the transition from fossil fuels to renewable energy sources, thereby promoting a sustainable future.




Forecasting power generation from renewables is crucial for price discovery, risk management and for balancing the power grid. Recent advances in ML/AI/Neural based weather modeling promise models which are orders of magnitude faster to run than traditional physics-based numerical weather models.




Your work as our new ML Weather Researcher will involve turning massive data sets of weather data into machine learning models that accurately predict short-term weather patterns and power production from renewables.




You will get instant validation of your work and experience short feedback cycles, where going from inception to deployment can be a matter of hours. There will be no red tape to cut and no sales people to consult. We are centrally located in Copenhagen and have 55 bright and ambitious team members.




About the Team

All of this will happen in an informal atmosphere where technical discussions are valued, and you are encouraged to take ownership of, and pride in, your work. You will impact the direction of the team, prioritize your work and choose the tools that get the job done. We are a tight-knit modeling team with passionate quantitative analysts covering 6 nationalities – a combination of PhD’s and MSc’s with expertise in statistical analysis, mathematical modeling and machine learning. We enjoy collaboration and are always willing to lend a helping hand. We are working alongside two other teams of software developers and economists that implement and conceive the mathematical models together with us. What makes this constellation work great is that all of the individual team members write code and understand that a seemingly trivial change can actually require a lot of work, and vice versa.




About You

Experience with ML/AI/Neural-based weather forecasting (GraphCast etc)
Experience with Deep Learning and Neural Networks
PhD or MSc degree in engineering, physics, computer science or relevant field
Familiar with terms like ECMWF IFS, HRRR, GFS, GOES etc.
Proficiency within computer science fundamentals, mathematics and statistics
Programming experience with Python, in particular data-wrangling and numerical programming
A scientific and inquisitive mind




What we can Offer You

Flat hierarchy and high levels of trust and autonomy
Exciting problems to solve
Collaborative team made up of really smart and curious people
Nice office in central Copenhagen with a hybrid work model
Pension, Health Insurance and 30 days of vacation




Practicalities

To apply, please send us your CV and a cover letter telling us why you think this role is a great fit for you. If your profile looks like a good match, we will get in touch to coordinate an online technical test as a first step in the interview process.

Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer, Computer Vision
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to develop computer vision and machine learning solutions for closing the gap between plan and reality for large scale construction projects, with the goal of minimizing waste through digitalization?

Your new role

Bringing data from offices to the construction site using 3D BIM models has long been part of our core expertise here at Dalux. Now, as one of the next steps in our effort to digitalize the construction industry, we are working to bring data from the construction site back into the office using modern Computer Vision techniques.

As a Machine Learning Engineer in our Computer Vision section, you will be a key part in delivery of the solutions into production. You will participate in the full lifecycle of the ML systems we build, while spearheading the model deployment, performance monitoring and maintenance, to ensure the reproducibility of our experiments and traceability of our pipelines in production. As part of the R&D team, you will be expected to keep up to date with the state-of-the-art in the ML/CV area as well as new techniques and processes.

Your background

We believe you…


Have 3+ years of experience as a Machine Learning Engineer, MLOps Engineer, or similar.
Have a proven track record of bringing machine learning models to production.
Have a solid theoretical foundation from a degree in computer science, engineering, IT or similar.
Can work both independently and as part of a team.


Most important is your problem-solving attitude, passion for software craftmanship, and the ambition to participate in the full lifecycle of our machine learning solutions.

Our tech...


Python
PyTorch
C++
OpenCV
AWS
MLFlow
Kubernetes


We are focused on using the right tools for the job, and as such the list of technologies may change depending on our needs and new offerings.

What To Expect As a Daluxian

In our organization the way from idea to product is short, combined with creative freedom and a high level of trust in your work, ensures that you will be able to create tangible value for our users.

You will become a part of a highly skilled team of passionate individuals driven by the wish to explore new and reshape existing technologies. As Dalux is a software company, we want half of the company to consist of Software Developers. All our software development happens at our head office at Vibenshuset in Copenhagen.

We offer...


Central location in Copenhagen, focus on work/life balance without any overtime, and no dress code.
An active social environment with monthly events and social clubs.
Flat communication in our organization, where the way from idea to product is short combined with creative freedom and a high level of trust in your work, ensures that you will be able to create tangible value for our users.
You’ll join a highly specialized, international team with room for creativity and professional growth.
Strong focus on diversity and inclusion – your ideas are heard, and opportunities are available to all.
Attractive employee benefits such as health insurance, lunch plan, coffee and fruit, free fitness facilities, and parking garage.
Focus on your development and well-being, with support for both professional goals and personal growth.


Ready for the next step

If Dalux sounds like a place where you could develop and contribute to the high-quality software, we would gladly accept your application. We will be having ongoing interviews.

If you have any questions, feel free to contact Simone Jena Berg Christensen.

Who Is Dalux

Dalux is a Danish software company founded in 2005 by Ph.D. Bent Dalgaard and Torben Dalgaard. Dalux’ products are aimed at making the construction industry smarter and more effective as it is the world’s 2nd largest industry and amongst the least digitalized. Our user-friendly digital tools and Building Information Modelling-technology (also known as BIM) is used in more than 160 countries globally.

We are crazy about cool technology and have experience being first movers on new tech. Our products are based on our unique 3D BIM-technology and makes use of AR - all developed entirely by Dalux.

Application deadline:

Ongoing

Title: Junior Software Developer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We're Catalysta, a SaaS solution helping organizations track, report, and reduce their greenhouse gas emissions. Our platform is based on first-hand learnings from 100+ GHG accounting projects and 20.000+ hours of work.

We raised a pre-seed round in November, onboarded Senior Developers and Head of UX through December and January, and have a pipeline of potential customers. We're now looking for a talented individual to help accelerate our pace of development and join us on our mission to make sustainability impact more transparent and actionable.

You will be working closely with the rest of the founding team to create a great product experience. 2025 is the year we will be launching our product and our focus now is on building the MVP.

This is a full-stack developer role but with emphasis on front-end. We build our platform in Django and our front-end is based on HTML templating, Bootstrap, and HTMX.

The role is based in central Copenhagen near Nørreport Station, and please note that we work from the office with some remote work flexibility. We collaborate closely in the team and discuss challenges as they come up. We share office space with the leading sustainability consultancy in the Nordics.

Responsibilities


Architecture & Development: Participate in the overall architectural decisions and implementation of the Catalysta platform.
Technology Selection: Drive the selection of appropriate technologies, frameworks, and tools for the application’s development, deployment, and scaling.
Collaboration: Work closely with the developer team to translate business needs into technical solutions, ensuring the development process aligns with the long-term goals of the company.
Quality Assurance: Ensuring security and maintaining high standards of quality are crucial in this domain. We believe in achieving this through continuous, small improvements, quick user feedback, and thorough testing. We expect that you embody these principles.

Title: Senior Data Scientist for Stress Testing the Credit Portfolio Losses
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Join our collaborative team driving the Stress test calculations on loan losses at Danske Bank. We are responsible for maintaining and operating a suite of models utilized by several departments across the bank.

A key aspect of the role is the ability to aggregate and present model outputs in a clear and understandable manner. Our team also supports the strategic risk steering of the bank through quantitative analysis, including setting risk tolerance levels to protect the bank against severe losses and conducting ‘what if’ analyses such as scenarios involving the return of inflation, increasing interest rates, and decreasing house prices.

You will join a friendly team of eight data scientists with diverse quantitative backgrounds. Half of the team is based in Copenhagen, while the other half works from Vilnius..

"Depending on your experience and knowledge, we may offer you different seniority of the role.

You will:


Co-own the continuous development and optimization of the bank’s stress test models in Python
Engage with stakeholders and continuously improve the understanding and presentation of model outputs
Deliver input to the dialogue with the bank's auditors, model validators, external audit, and regulatory authorities


The tasks of the team are varied and model-centric, and we value the diverse skills each team member brings. If you are passionate about data science and are ready to embark on your career with us, we encourage you to apply.

About you:


Proficiency in Python
Experience in presenting and visualizing complex data to stakeholders
Experience in working with Amazon Web Services (AWS) cloud-based setups
A solid quantitative background
Proactive mindset with great collaboration and communication skills
Analytical skills with the ability to communicate technical information in a non-technical and concise manner
Banking experience is welcome but not essential; however, a genuine interest in exploring the fascinating world of banking is expected
Experience in building and operating models is highly valued


“We invite candidates with a degree in a quantitative field to apply, even if you do not meet every skill listed. Your enthusiasm and potential could be exactly what we need.”

We offer:

This position can be located both in Lithuania and Denmark. If you are hired in Lithuania, the applicable salary range will be from 3280 to 4920 EUR monthly (based on your competencies relevant for the job)

Additionally, each Danske Bank employee receives employee benefits package which includes:


Growth opportunities: professional & supportive team, e-learnings, numerous development programs; (incl. professional certificates); 100+ professions for internal mobility opportunities.
Health & Well-being: a diverse, inclusive, work & life balance work environment; additional health insurance; mental well-being practices; partial psychologist counselling compensation; silence and sleep zones at the office; game rooms.
Hybrid working conditions: Work from home up to two days a week; home office budget (after the probation period); modern Danske Campus workplace developed with anthropologist for the best employee experience.
Additional days of leave: for rest, health, volunteering, exams in higher education institutions, and other important activities. Moreover, for seniority with Danske Bank.
Monetary compensation package: accidents & critical diseases insurance; financial support in case of unfortunate events, travel insurance; III rd Pillar Pension Fund contribution.


See all the benefits HERE.

Your title in job contract will be Data Scientist, Senior.

Feel free to contact me @LinkedIn if you have any questions! Lars Thejls Aagaard, Head of Portfolio Intelligence, FVP at Danske Bank

#LT

About Us

Danske Bank is a Nordic bank with bridges to the world around us. For 150 years, we have supported people and businesses in releasing their potential. A career with us is an opportunity to join a community of 22,000 colleagues in a culture where we are committed to Teaming Up, Owning It and Being Open. Together, we are on a journey to transform Danske Bank into a better bank. For our customers, our employees and the societies around us.

Join our collaborative team driving the Stress test calculations on loan losses at Danske Bank. We are responsible for maintaining and operating a suite of models utilized by several departments across the bank.

A key aspect of the role is the ability to aggregate and present model outputs in a clear and understandable manner. Our team also supports the strategic risk steering of the bank through quantitative analysis, including setting risk tolerance levels to protect the bank against severe losses and conducting ‘what if’ analyses such as scenarios involving the return of inflation, increasing interest rates, and decreasing house prices.

You will join a friendly team of eight data scientists with diverse quantitative backgrounds. Half of the team is based in Copenhagen, while the other half works from Vilnius..

"Depending on your experience and knowledge, we may offer you different seniority of the role.

You will:

  • Co-own the continuous development and optimization of the bank’s stress test models in Python
  • Engage with stakeholders and continuously improve the understanding and presentation of model outputs
  • Deliver input to the dialogue with the bank's auditors, model validators, external audit, and regulatory authorities

The tasks of the team are varied and model-centric, and we value the diverse skills each team member brings. If you are passionate about data science and are ready to embark on your career with us, we encourage you to apply.

About you:

  • Proficiency in Python
  • Experience in presenting and visualizing complex data to stakeholders
  • Experience in working with Amazon Web Services (AWS) cloud-based setups
  • A solid quantitative background
  • Proactive mindset with great collaboration and communication skills
  • Analytical skills with the ability to communicate technical information in a non-technical and concise manner
  • Banking experience is welcome but not essential; however, a genuine interest in exploring the fascinating world of banking is expected
  • Experience in building and operating models is highly valued

“We invite candidates with a degree in a quantitative field to apply, even if you do not meet every skill listed. Your enthusiasm and potential could be exactly what we need.”

We offer:

This position can be located both in Lithuania and Denmark. If you are hired in Lithuania, the applicable salary range will be from 3280 to 4920 EUR monthly (based on your competencies relevant for the job)

Additionally, each Danske Bank employee receives employee benefits package which includes:

  • Growth opportunities: professional & supportive team, e-learnings, numerous development programs; (incl. professional certificates); 100+ professions for internal mobility opportunities.
  • Health & Well-being: a diverse, inclusive, work & life balance work environment; additional health insurance; mental well-being practices; partial psychologist counselling compensation; silence and sleep zones at the office; game rooms.
  • Hybrid working conditions: Work from home up to two days a week; home office budget (after the probation period); modern Danske Campus workplace developed with anthropologist for the best employee experience.
  • Additional days of leave: for rest, health, volunteering, exams in higher education institutions, and other important activities. Moreover, for seniority with Danske Bank.
  • Monetary compensation package: accidents & critical diseases insurance; financial support in case of unfortunate events, travel insurance; III rd Pillar Pension Fund contribution.

See all the benefits HERE.

Your title in job contract will be Data Scientist, Senior.

Feel free to contact me @LinkedIn if you have any questions! Lars Thejls Aagaard, Head of Portfolio Intelligence, FVP at Danske Bank

#LT

About Us

Danske Bank is a Nordic bank with bridges to the world around us. For 150 years, we have supported people and businesses in releasing their potential. A career with us is an opportunity to join a community of 22,000 colleagues in a culture where we are committed to Teaming Up, Owning It and Being Open. Together, we are on a journey to transform Danske Bank into a better bank. For our customers, our employees and the societies around us.

Title: Data Scientist, Computer Vision
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to develop computer vision and machine learning solutions for closing the gap between plan and reality for large scale construction projects, with the goal of minimizing waste through digitalization?

Your new role

Bringing data from offices to the construction site using 3D BIM models has long been part of our core expertise here at Dalux. Now, as one of the next steps in our effort to digitalize the construction industry, we are working to bring data from the construction site back into the office using modern Computer Vision techniques.

As a Data Scientist in our Computer Vision section, you will develop and deploy deep learning models to improve the understanding, alignment and correspondence between 3D models of the construction site and video data gathered using our vSLAM system. As part of an R&D team, you will work on discovery of new solutions through research and rapid prototyping, and translating the findings into delivery of high quality solutions to complex computer vision problems.

Your background

We believe you…


Have a solid theoretical foundation from a degree in computer science, engineering, IT or similar.
Have a hands-on experience with software development using C++, Python or C#. It is important that you have reached solid coding standards and strive for continuous improvement.
Have a machine learning experience or trained in the area. Hands-on experience with PyTorch and MLFlow is a plus.
Have computer vision experience or trained in the area. Hands-on experience with OpenCV is a plus.
Can work both independently and as part of a team.


Most important is your problem-solving attitude, passion for software craftmanship, and the ambition to participate in the full lifecycle of our machine learning solutions.

Our tech...


C++
OpenGL
Python
PyTorch
MLFlow
Kubernetes


We are focused on using the right tools for the job, and as such the list of technologies may change depending on our needs and new offerings.

What To Expect As a Daluxian

In our organization the way from idea to product is short, combined with creative freedom and a high level of trust in your work, ensures that you will be able to create tangible value for our users.

You will become a part of a highly skilled team of passionate individuals driven by the wish to explore new and reshape existing technologies. As Dalux is a software company, we want half of the company to consist of Software Developers. All our software development happens at our head office at Vibenshuset in Copenhagen.

We offer...


Central location in Copenhagen, focus on work/life balance without any overtime, and no dress code.
An active social environment with monthly events and social clubs.
Flat communication in our organization, where the way from idea to product is short combined with creative freedom and a high level of trust in your work, ensures that you will be able to create tangible value for our users.
You’ll join a highly specialized, international team with room for creativity and professional growth.
Strong focus on diversity and inclusion – your ideas are heard, and opportunities are available to all.
Attractive employee benefits such as health insurance, lunch plan, coffee and fruit, free fitness facilities, and parking garage.
Focus on your development and well-being, with support for both professional goals and personal growth.


Ready for the next step

If Dalux sounds like a place where you could develop and contribute to the high-quality software, we would gladly accept your application. We will be having ongoing interviews.

If you have any questions, feel free to contact Simone Jena Berg Christensen.

Who Is Dalux

Dalux is a Danish software company founded in 2005 by Ph.D. Bent Dalgaard and Torben Dalgaard. Dalux’ products are aimed at making the construction industry smarter and more effective as it is the world’s 2nd largest industry and amongst the least digitalized. Our user-friendly digital tools and Building Information Modelling-technology (also known as BIM) is used in more than 160 countries globally.

We are crazy about cool technology and have experience being first movers on new tech. Our products are based on our unique 3D BIM-technology and makes use of AR - all developed entirely by Dalux.

Application deadline:

Ongoing

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Do you have a strategic and analytical mindset? Do you possess a proactive attitude and thrive in a dynamic environment? Do you fancy a career as a data scientist in Denmark’s largest retailer?

Then you might be our new colleague

We are looking for business minded colleagues to be part of our newly established Supply Chain Development team in Netto.

You and the team will have the responsibility of driving strategic projects across business units, namely Netto, føtex and Bilka, utilizing and processing the huge amount of data available in Salling Group leading to insights that enable more informed business decision-making creating a difference for our customers.

Your Tasks And Responsibilities


Through data analyses create insights to support core retail processes regarding e.g. product availability across stores and distribution centres
Together with the team, design, develop and implement tools and models that utilize the data to create business impact in new ways
Ensure efficient data availability including tailor-build tools
Support the general data-driven transformation across Salling Group
Drive step-change improvements to core forecasting and allocation IT infrastructure in close collaboration with internal and external stakeholders


Your Skills And Background

You have a Master’s degree within economics, IT, engineering or other natural science degrees (e.g. cand.scient, cand.oecon, cand.merc). Preferably, you have a couple of years’ of experience as a data scientist or in a similar role, where you have acquired the necessary skills to succeed as a data scientist.

Alternatively, you compensate for your lack of experience by being a top-performer and by having relevant experience in a student job during your studies. You have a natural interest in data and how it can be utilized to create business impact. Beside your passion for data, you have a strong business acumen enabling you to utilize the right data and making the best analysis for the problem at hand.

You have an analytical mindset, a structured way of working and is a real problem-solver. You have experience with extracting, cleaning and transforming data as well as data modelling creating measures and reports that support solid business decisions across Salling Group.

You have experience with programming/scripting languages such as R, Python, VBA, DAX and SQL.

As a person you are curious of nature and have an eagerness to take on a very steep learning-curve. You are proactive and have a ‘self-starter attitude’ and can independently focus, see opportunities and invite yourself to the table. As you will interact with many stakeholders in the organization, you must also have personal presence and the ability to present your points convincingly.

Fluency in Danish is a prerequisite.

We offer


An exciting career with a steep learning curve in an international company in continued growth, giving you extensive opportunity for both personal and professional growth
A diversified job with impact and responsibilities
Being part of a highly professional team in a dynamic environment offering you deep insights in retail
Competitive salary package and benefits


Are you the person for the job?

Send your application, resume and copy of your grades as soon as possible - and no later than 2 March 2025 – through the link on this page.

Please note that applications will be assessed on an ongoing basis and therefore the job application may close before the recruitment process is completed if we have proceeded with candidates to the screening or interview phase

Feel free to contact: Head of Supply Chain and Logistics, Nikolaj Holm Hansen, at +45 2363 9188 if you have further inquiries on the position.

Title: Natural Language Processing (NLP) Researcher
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to impact a highly-skilled team that uses cutting edge techniques in Natural Language Processing and Algorithmic Trading? We are looking for an NLP Researcher that will help us greatly improve the text-processing behind our models.




At Alipes Capital, we have been the market leader in automating the financial markets since we started back in 2008, shaping a fully automatic natural language processing system for reading and interpreting financial news.




Your work

Your work will support turning massive data sets of unstructured financial information into structured datasets and mathematical models that accurately predict movements in the equity markets. In doing so, you will:

Redesign and introduce new text-processing techniques to extract additional and more accurate entities from the text-sources that underlie our trading algorithms
Maintain and curate new and existing text data sources for our analyses
Automate monitoring and benchmarking of the trading strategies




You will enjoy a wide degree of autonomy and responsibility to optimize our machine-learning pipelines, from data-ingestion to live-model performance. There is no red tape, no sales people to consult and there is ample room for creativity.




The team

All of this will happen in an informal atmosphere where technical discussions are valued and you are encouraged to take ownership of, and pride in, your work. You will impact the direction of the team, prioritize your work and choose the tools that get the job done. We are a tight-knit modeling team with fourteen passionate quantitative researchers covering six nationalities – eleven PhD’s and three MSc’s- with expertise in statistical analysis, mathematical modeling and machine learning (seven of us working directly on the text-based equity models).




We enjoy collaboration, lending a helping hand and discussing the business cases built upon our data-sets. You will be working alongside a team of software developers and a team of traders who implement and conceive the trading models with us. All team members write code and are not afraid to discuss technical details.




Need to have

Skilled in extracting signals from texts using embeddings to enhance prediction model
Proficient in entity-extraction from text, e.g. using modern Transformer-based Large-Language Models
Solid understanding of machine learning techniques and their practical applications
Aptitude for programming in a numerical scripting language (we primarily use Python)
A meticulous and detail-oriented mind




Nice to have

Experience using RAGs (Retrieval-Augmentation-Generation)
Working with financial/trading data
Experience with C#, C/C++ or Java
Familiarity with software engineering (version control, unit testing, object oriented-design)
Degree in Computer Science / Engineering




What we can offer you

Flat hierarchy and high levels of trust and autonomy
Exciting problems to solve
Collaborative team made up of really smart and curious people
Nice office in central Copenhagen with a hybrid work model
Pension, Health Insurance and 30 days of vacation




Practicalities

To apply, please send us your CV and a cover letter telling us why you think this role is a great fit for you. In your cover letter, if applicable, please describe a project where you extracted structured or unstructured information from text - including the techniques, tools, models used and how those extractions informed further decisions/predictions.

If you're selected for an interview, we will be very interested in discussing technical details with you about this project!

Should your profile look like a good match, we will get in touch to coordinate an online technical test as a first step in the interview process.

Show more

Title: Software Engineer Data Scientist
Place: Rom By, Central Denmark Region, Denmark
Description:
CHE COSA CERCHIAMO

Rheinmetall Italia S.p.A sta cercando un/una Software Engineer Data Scientist da inserire all’interno dell'unità Sviluppo Software, per la propria sede di Roma.

Siamo leader mondiale nella Difesa e Sicurezza, operiamo in oltre 60 paesi come parte di uno dei principali gruppi industriali europei, Rheinmetall AG e siamo l’unica azienda nel settore della Difesa nel novero dei 40 titoli tedeschi a maggiore capitalizzazione e liquidità quotati sul segmento “Prime Standard” della Borsa di Francoforte (Dax 40).

Siamo un'azienda che sta affrontando un processo di evoluzione e trasformazione digitale in grado di creare opportunità di carriera in un ambiente di apprendimento e sviluppo continuo.

Etica, integrità, sostenibilità, inclusione, customer-centricity e innovazione sono i nostri valori da cui discende l'impegno per le nostre persone.

Sei una persona innovativa che ricerca il miglioramento continuo in tutto quello che fa?

Ti piace lavorare in team per migliorare i processi e le prestazioni della funzione in cui lavori?

Vuoi avere un ruolo attivo, che ti venga riconosciuto, nella crescita aziendale?

Vuoi lavorare con i migliori tecnici e/o ingegneri presenti nel mercato della difesa?

Vuoi acquisire nuove competenze e soft skills?

In qualità di Software Engineer Data Scientist sarai inserito/a in un team rivolto alla ricerca dell’eccellenza, e sarai coinvolto/a nello sviluppo e nell’implementazione di soluzioni AI e di analisi avanzata dei dati, che assumono un ruolo strategico e mission-critical in una molteplicità di contesti. Lavorerai a stretto contatto con ingegneri e altri professionisti del settore, all’interno di team multidisciplinari, seguendo le pratiche Agile per la progettazione e realizzazione di modelli e pipeline di data processing.

Il Software Engineer nella funzione di Data Scientistsarà responsabile della raccolta, elaborazione e modellazione dei dati, nonché dell’implementazione di soluzioni di Machine Learning/Deep Learning di alta qualità, garantendone la validazione e la manutenzione. Collabora con il team, documenta il lavoro per assicurare la consegna di prodotti e analisi efficienti e funzionali, infine apprende costantemente nuove pratiche, framework e algoritmi di Intelligenza Artificiale.

La posizione prevede la progettazione e l’implementazione di modelli predittivi, di pipeline di elaborazione dati robuste, di alta qualità, che assicurino affidabilità, efficienza, sicurezza e manutenibilità. Verrà curato l’intero ciclo di vita dei progetti di AI: dall’analisi dei requisiti e della qualità dei dati, attraverso la definizione dei modelli e la loro validazione, fino all’integrazione su infrastrutture di calcolo on-premise o cloud.

Le tue principali attività saranno:



Analisi dei requisiti di sistema e studi di fattibilità;
Sviluppo e progettazione di applicativi di Data Science e non solo;
Realizzazione di pipeline dati (ETL/ELT), scripting e automazione di processi di data cleaning e feature engineering;
Redazione della documentazione tecnica in conformità agli standard aziendali e alle best practices;
Progettazione di suite di test per la validazione di modelli di Machine Learning/Deep Learning;
Ottimizzazione delle prestazioni, tuning degli algoritmi e delle pipeline di elaborazione dati, utilizzo di profiler e tool di analisi di performance;
Utilizzo di tools di gestione del ciclo di vita del software e di Continuos Integration/Delivery;
Garantire la qualità dei prodotti secondo gli standard aziendali.



CHE COSA DEVI PORTARE CON TE

Valutiamo con interesse:



Laurea Magistrale in Informatica o Ing. Informatica con focus su Intelligenza Artificiale;
Buona conoscenza della Iingua inglese parlata e scritta (livello B2);
Ottima conoscenza dei principali standard di analisi e progettazione del software O.O;
Ottima conoscenza di tutto il ciclo di vita del software e dei progetti di AI;
Ottima conoscenza di Python, Java e/o C++;
Ottima conoscenza dei framework/librerie TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch, LangChain;
Ottima conoscenza dei DB sia SQL che NoSQL;
Buona conoscenza dei principali strumenti di analisi dei dati: Pandas, NumPy, Matplotlib;
Buona conoscenza dei principi di TDD e Unit Testing per il test e la validazione del software prodotto;
Buone capacità di ottimizzazione del software attraverso l'uso di profiler e tools per l'analisi del codice statica e dinamica.



CHE COSA TI OFFRIAMO

Cosa offriamo:



Ambiente internazionale e caratterizzato da sfide e dinamicità
Opportunità di sviluppo professionale
Programmi di alta formazione
Un contesto lavorativo inclusivo, che abbraccia e valorizza l'unicità in tutte le sue forme
Retribuzione in linea con i maggiori players, proporzionata alle competenze e alla seniority possedute, che sarà compresa fra i 35k e i 40k
Programmi di Welfare innovativi e costruiti intorno alle persone
Assicurazione sanitaria
Ristorante Aziendale
Parcheggio per i dipendenti
Servizio Concierge
Modello di lavoro ibrido
Flessibilità oraria



Valutiamo con estremo interesse le candidature appartenenti alle categorie protette ai sensi degli artt. 1 e 18, legge 68/99.

Il presente annuncio è rivolto ad entrambi i sessi, ai sensi delle leggi 903/77 e 125/91, e a persone di tutte le età e tutte le nazionalità, ai sensi dei DL 215/03 e 216/03.

Le persone sono il nostro ASSET aziendale e rappresentano un patrimonio imprescindibile per l’innovazione del nostro business. I continui cambiamenti tecnologici e le trasformazioni del mercato richiedono flessibilità di pensiero, apprendimento rapido e mobilità. Invece della standardizzazione di massa, noi abbracciamo l'unicità di massa e la centricità umana.

_______________________________________________________________________

N.B.: Thank you for attaching your cv.

This announcement is addressed to both sexes, in accordance with Laws 903/77 and 125/91, and to people of all ages and nationalities, in accordance with DL 215/03 and 216/03.

We undertake to evaluate candidates belonging to the protected categories pursuant to art. 1 and 18, law 68/99.

PER INFORMAZIONI



migliarini@rheinmetall.it

HTML:
CHE COSA CERCHIAMO

Rheinmetall Italia S.p.A sta cercando un/una Software Engineer Data Scientist da inserire all’interno dell'unità Sviluppo Software, per la propria sede di Roma.

Siamo leader mondiale nella Difesa e Sicurezza, operiamo in oltre 60 paesi come parte di uno dei principali gruppi industriali europei, Rheinmetall AG e siamo l’unica azienda nel settore della Difesa nel novero dei 40 titoli tedeschi a maggiore capitalizzazione e liquidità quotati sul segmento “Prime Standard” della Borsa di Francoforte (Dax 40).

Siamo un'azienda che sta affrontando un processo di evoluzione e trasformazione digitale in grado di creare opportunità di carriera in un ambiente di apprendimento e sviluppo continuo.

Etica, integrità, sostenibilità, inclusione, customer-centricity e innovazione sono i nostri valori da cui discende l'impegno per le nostre persone.

Sei una persona innovativa che ricerca il miglioramento continuo in tutto quello che fa?

Ti piace lavorare in team per migliorare i processi e le prestazioni della funzione in cui lavori?

Vuoi avere un ruolo attivo, che ti venga riconosciuto, nella crescita aziendale?

Vuoi lavorare con i migliori tecnici e/o ingegneri presenti nel mercato della difesa?

Vuoi acquisire nuove competenze e soft skills?

In qualità di Software Engineer Data Scientist sarai inserito/a in un team rivolto alla ricerca dell’eccellenza, e sarai coinvolto/a nello sviluppo e nell’implementazione di soluzioni AI e di analisi avanzata dei dati, che assumono un ruolo strategico e mission-critical in una molteplicità di contesti. Lavorerai a stretto contatto con ingegneri e altri professionisti del settore, all’interno di team multidisciplinari, seguendo le pratiche Agile per la progettazione e realizzazione di modelli e pipeline di data processing.

Il Software Engineer nella funzione di Data Scientistsarà responsabile della raccolta, elaborazione e modellazione dei dati, nonché dell’implementazione di soluzioni di Machine Learning/Deep Learning di alta qualità, garantendone la validazione e la manutenzione. Collabora con il team, documenta il lavoro per assicurare la consegna di prodotti e analisi efficienti e funzionali, infine apprende costantemente nuove pratiche, framework e algoritmi di Intelligenza Artificiale.

La posizione prevede la progettazione e l’implementazione di modelli predittivi, di pipeline di elaborazione dati robuste, di alta qualità, che assicurino affidabilità, efficienza, sicurezza e manutenibilità. Verrà curato l’intero ciclo di vita dei progetti di AI: dall’analisi dei requisiti e della qualità dei dati, attraverso la definizione dei modelli e la loro validazione, fino all’integrazione su infrastrutture di calcolo on-premise o cloud.

Le tue principali attività saranno:


  • Analisi dei requisiti di sistema e studi di fattibilità;
  • Sviluppo e progettazione di applicativi di Data Science e non solo;
  • Realizzazione di pipeline dati (ETL/ELT), scripting e automazione di processi di data cleaning e feature engineering;
  • Redazione della documentazione tecnica in conformità agli standard aziendali e alle best practices;
  • Progettazione di suite di test per la validazione di modelli di Machine Learning/Deep Learning;
  • Ottimizzazione delle prestazioni, tuning degli algoritmi e delle pipeline di elaborazione dati, utilizzo di profiler e tool di analisi di performance;
  • Utilizzo di tools di gestione del ciclo di vita del software e di Continuos Integration/Delivery;
  • Garantire la qualità dei prodotti secondo gli standard aziendali.


CHE COSA DEVI PORTARE CON TE

Valutiamo con interesse:


  • Laurea Magistrale in Informatica o Ing. Informatica con focus su Intelligenza Artificiale;
  • Buona conoscenza della Iingua inglese parlata e scritta (livello B2);
  • Ottima conoscenza dei principali standard di analisi e progettazione del software O.O;
  • Ottima conoscenza di tutto il ciclo di vita del software e dei progetti di AI;
  • Ottima conoscenza di Python, Java e/o C++;
  • Ottima conoscenza dei framework/librerie TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch, LangChain;
  • Ottima conoscenza dei DB sia SQL che NoSQL;
  • Buona conoscenza dei principali strumenti di analisi dei dati: Pandas, NumPy, Matplotlib;
  • Buona conoscenza dei principi di TDD e Unit Testing per il test e la validazione del software prodotto;
  • Buone capacità di ottimizzazione del software attraverso l'uso di profiler e tools per l'analisi del codice statica e dinamica.


CHE COSA TI OFFRIAMO

Cosa offriamo:


  • Ambiente internazionale e caratterizzato da sfide e dinamicità
  • Opportunità di sviluppo professionale
  • Programmi di alta formazione
  • Un contesto lavorativo inclusivo, che abbraccia e valorizza l'unicità in tutte le sue forme
  • Retribuzione in linea con i maggiori players, proporzionata alle competenze e alla seniority possedute, che sarà compresa fra i 35k e i 40k
  • Programmi di Welfare innovativi e costruiti intorno alle persone
  • Assicurazione sanitaria
  • Ristorante Aziendale
  • Parcheggio per i dipendenti
  • Servizio Concierge
  • Modello di lavoro ibrido
  • Flessibilità oraria


Valutiamo con estremo interesse le candidature appartenenti alle categorie protette ai sensi degli artt. 1 e 18, legge 68/99.

Il presente annuncio è rivolto ad entrambi i sessi, ai sensi delle leggi 903/77 e 125/91, e a persone di tutte le età e tutte le nazionalità, ai sensi dei DL 215/03 e 216/03.

Le persone sono il nostro ASSET aziendale e rappresentano un patrimonio imprescindibile per l’innovazione del nostro business. I continui cambiamenti tecnologici e le trasformazioni del mercato richiedono flessibilità di pensiero, apprendimento rapido e mobilità. Invece della standardizzazione di massa, noi abbracciamo l'unicità di massa e la centricità umana.

_______________________________________________________________________

N.B.: Thank you for attaching your cv.

This announcement is addressed to both sexes, in accordance with Laws 903/77 and 125/91, and to people of all ages and nationalities, in accordance with DL 215/03 and 216/03.

We undertake to evaluate candidates belonging to the protected categories pursuant to art. 1 and 18, law 68/99.

PER INFORMAZIONI


  • migliarini@rheinmetall.it

Title: Embedded Software Developer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to develop innovative product that saves lives and improves patient care? Do you have a degree in electronics engineering or computer science with strong experience in embedded devices?

Then this might be your defining moment. Apply today and join us for a career forever forward!

Local role with global impact

In this role, you will bepart of the Embedded Software Team in the Software and Electronics department within R&D out of HQ in Ballerup, Denmark. Our embedded team is diverse and consists of 9 developers and a SW test engineer. We focus on creating a modular platform with interfaces to the application SW team and the hardware team.  

The embedded software team works in a very collaborative and agile environment, where open and honest discussions are an integral part of the way we solve complex problems. For new team members, we value the willingness to learn new skills and to grow, rather than already having detailed knowledge of everything. 

As an Embedded Software Developer, you will take part in delivering our software projects within scope, time and quality. You will deliver high quality code in C and C++ and collaborate with your team members about shaping the best possible solutions. 

  

More concretely, your work will involve the following: 


Develop functionality in firmware, software and drivers 
Work with your embedded SW team and the application SW team on interfaces and functionality in the display unit 
Support the documentation effort to comply with software medical device and cybersecurity standards 


  

Suggested candidate profile

Setting you up for success is one of our cornerstones. In order to do so, we imagine you have a university background within electronics or computer science or similar and broad experience as a software developer. As a person you are eager to learn new skills as well as share your knowledge.

Experience or knowledge of the following is highly relevant: 


Have a minimum of 5 years of exerience in Embedded Software
Embedded Linux (preferably Yocto) 
Developing SW and documentation for medical devices
Implementing Linux drivers 
Developing on Microcontroller(preferably ARM)
C, C++, Python, shell


English, both written and spoken, is crucial for the role.

Deadline

The Talent Attraction team will engage with candidates on an ongoing basis, hence we encourage you to not hesitate, and apply!

Questions? Reach out to Head of Embedded Software, René Rosendahl at rero@ambu.com

Ambu – a visionary and international workplace where your efforts matter

Ambu is a company that expands rapidly and has ambitious growth targets. We meet these targets through interdisciplinary teamwork between motivated and highly skilled employees. Your contributions and efforts are crucial to our success and by joining us you will get the opportunity to work in an international head office with an informal working environment.

 

We offer great opportunities for personal development. Furthermore, we offer a wide range of professional, social and financial employee benefits in addition to exciting job challenges and continuous professional and personal development.
Show more

Title: Research Scientist
Description:
Do you have a passion for science and a drive to make a real-world impact? We are on the lookout for an innovative and enthusiastic Research Scientist for our growing Research team in R&D at Novo Nordisk Pharmatech (NNPR) in Køge, Denmark. So, if you envision being part of the journey expanding our existing product portfolio to include innovative resins for purification and other applications, you might be the right match!

Apply today and take the next steps of what will be a life-changing career!

The position
As a Research Scientist you’ll be diving headfirst into exciting R&D initiatives, taking projects from concept to completion. Your mission will focus on upscaling laboratory processes to production scale, including the setup of pilot-scale facilities. This is an exciting opportunity to work on groundbreaking projects, learn from seasoned experts, and contribute to the development of next-generation materials.

Key Responsibilities:



Design, conduct, and analyze experiments to develop new products and improve existing ones.
Lead efforts to scale up laboratory processes to production scale, addressing any challenges that arise during the transition.
Work closely with cross-functional teams, including R&D, production, and quality assurance, to ensure project success.
Prepare technical reports, and presentations, to showcase your research findings.
Characterize properties using advanced techniques like spectroscopy, chromatography, microscopy, light scattering and thermal analysis.




Qualifications

The ideal candidate for this position has master’s degree in chemistry, materials science, or a related field. Additionally, you will possess the following skills and experiences:



Effective collaborator with excellent communication and project management skills, capable of working seamlessly with cross-functional teams such as R&D, production, and quality assurance
Proven experience in a laboratory setting with practical, hands-on assignments is essential.
A background in experimental organic chemistry is preferred but not required.
Demonstrated experience in scaling up processes from laboratory to production scale.
Experience in setting up and optimizing pilot-scale facilities.
Commitment to maintaining a safe and compliant laboratory environment.




On a personal level, you have a genuine enthusiasm for scientific research and development, you are a lively and dynamic team player, always full of energy and enthusiasm. You stay focused and detail-oriented, pushing projects forward with a positive, can-do attitude. You thrive on working together, valuing teamwork and sharing knowledge, and believe the best solutions come from our combined efforts. Your open and honest approach, along with your passion, inspires those around you, making you a motivating force in the team.

About The Department

As scientist in R&D Research you will be part of the innovation of new products. The department consist of 16 highly motivated and skilled scientists and laboratory technicians, divided into two teams. Our research team is dedicated to pioneering and advancing products specifically designed for affinity resin applications. We work closely with the R&D Manufacturing Development teams and the New Product Marketing team as well as several close collaborators at Novo Nordisk.

Working at Novo Nordisk Pharmatech
Novo Nordisk Pharmatech A/S has 450+ employees and is 100% owned by Novo Nordisk A/S. The ability of Novo Nordisk Pharmatech A/S to produce and deliver quality products to the pharmaceutical industry, combined with our complete range of services within regulatory requirements, makes us a preferred supplier to many global pharmaceutical companies. Novo Nordisk Pharmatech A/S is a fast-growing company that generates many exciting projects and excellent development opportunities.

At Novo Nordisk Pharmatech we to aspire to be a part of the best company in the world, and we know that this is only possible with talented employees with diverse perspectives, backgrounds, and cultures. We are therefore committed to creating an inclusive culture that celebrates the diversity of our employees, the patients we serve, and the communities we operate in.

Contact
For further information, please contact manager Peter Lund Hammershøj (+45 31970239)

Deadline
16 February 2025

You do not need to attach a cover letter to your application, but please include a few sentences about why you are applying in your resume or CV. To ensure an efficient and fair recruitment process, please refrain from adding a photo in your CV.

We commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants.

At Novo Nordisk we recognize that it is no longer good enough to aspire to be the best company in the world. We need to aspire to be the best company for the world and we know that this is only possible with talented employees with diverse perspectives, backgrounds and cultures. We are therefore committed to creating an inclusive culture that celebrates the diversity of our employees, the patients we serve and communities we operate in. Together, we’re life changing.
Show more

Title: Lead Data Scientist
Description:
As the Lead Data Scientist at Grundfos, your primary responsibility will be to lead the data science component of multiple projects. These projects will involve extracting valuable insights and developing AI/ML features for the company's digital products and solutions. You will have a combination of hands-on tasks and leadership responsibilities as we introduce an AI-powered portfolio to the market.

What is the job about?

Your daily interactions as a professional at Grundfos require effective communication skills, as you collaborate with various stakeholders such as business owners, technical experts, and employees from diverse backgrounds. It is important for you to prioritize projects correctly and provide clarity on the necessary steps for a successful digital future. One of your key responsibilities will be to ensure that projects are prepared for adaptability to new solutions, with a focus on achieving end-to-end readiness.

As part of the AI Solutions department within Grundfos' Digital Development, you will join a highly skilled team of Data Scientists and Data Engineers. Together, you will play a pivotal role in driving the company's digital transformation agenda by actively working towards implementing advanced analytics and AI capabilities into Grundfos' digital products and solutions, actively contributing to the company's digital service portfolio evolution.

Additionally, you will have the opportunity to guide and mentor junior data scientists, assisting them in developing effective AI/ML solutions for different projects. These projects will address crucial areas such as monitoring and optimizing water systems, enhancing energy efficiency in pumping applications, detecting anomalies in IoT data, and creating predictive maintenance solutions for pumping systems.

Your main responsibilities:


Working with machine learning and advancing statistical procedures in different projects for obtaining actionable insights and development of relevant AI/ML features for Grundfos digital products and solutions.
Guide junior and senior data scientist
Working with both development and deployment of data science processes integrated with our Data and AI platforms.
Suggesting, scoping, and formulating data-driven projects based on business's interests.
Active communication with relevant stakeholders and discussion about potential AI/ML based solutions for different business sectors.
Staying informed about recent updates and developments in Data Science field for improving the results of data science projects.
Leading, with the unit manager, the analytics and AI roadmap of digital products in collaboration with relevant business stakeholders in divisions


Your background:

We imagine that you have:


Advanced degree in data science, statistics, computer science, or similar.
Extensive experience of using statistical and mathematical modelling based on IOT data in cloud or edge including timeseries analysis/forecasting, optimization techniques, and various supervised/unsupervised machine learning methods. It is an advantage also if you have previous experience of working with video, image, and audio data.
At least five years of experience in a similar position.
Proficiency in python
In-depth understanding of data models and data management
It is an advantage if you have practical experience with MLOPs (Machine Learning Operations), DevOps process/pipelines and related cloud services/technologies for deployment of ML solutions (e.g., MLflow, Docker, Kubernetes, Azure ML, Snowflake, etc.).
Ability to work in multidisciplinary teams and active communication with different stakeholders from program managers, product owners, UI/UX developers, R&D researchers, testers, application experts, system architectures and sales and service colleagues.
Good communicational skills in English in both speech and writing.
Good soft skills such as excellent in presentation and visualization, quick learner in new business domain, making complex information easy to understand, communicate at different levels such as software developers, manager, business owners, and tech specialists.


What’s in it for you?

Whether it’s developing leadership skills or advancing your expertise even further, we’ll support you with continuous learning and development opportunities, to help discuss and steer your long-term Grundfos career path. You’ll be welcomed from day one into an inclusive, trusting environment guided by six core values.

In addition, your day-to-day benefits include:


We encourage you to be at the offices, where you can engage, learn, and have fun with colleagues. If you’ll be working from your home office, we’ll make sure you are well equipped with a good workstation
On top of it, flexible working hours and up to 3 days’ additional paid leave for volunteering of your choice
Annual bonuses, health insurance, parental support, internal well-being consultants and programmes
Access to the modern Grundfos Academy to pursue further both personal and professional development
Diverse, inclusive environment with employee-led forums offering colleagues a safe place to connect and share openly


Do you want to learn more?

If this job sounds appealing, please send your resume by clicking “Apply”.

To dig deeper into the Grundfos universe, follow us on LinkedIn or Youtube, and to get to know some of your future colleagues and why they love working at Grundfos, check out Meet our people

We look forward to hearing from you.
Show more

In addition, your day-to-day benefits include:

  • We encourage you to be at the offices, where you can engage, learn, and have fun with colleagues. If you’ll be working from your home office, we’ll make sure you are well equipped with a good workstation
  • On top of it, flexible working hours and up to 3 days’ additional paid leave for volunteering of your choice
  • Annual bonuses, health insurance, parental support, internal well-being consultants and programmes
  • Access to the modern Grundfos Academy to pursue further both personal and professional development
  • Diverse, inclusive environment with employee-led forums offering colleagues a safe place to connect and share openly

Do you want to learn more?

If this job sounds appealing, please send your resume by clicking “Apply”.

To dig deeper into the Grundfos universe, follow us on LinkedIn or Youtube, and to get to know some of your future colleagues and why they love working at Grundfos, check out Meet our people

We look forward to hearing from you.

Title: Software Developer (Python skills required)
Description:
Company Description

Join Netcompany in leveraging technological innovations to foster societal transformation.

Netcompany was awarded 5th position on the esteemed UK Top 50 Best Places to Work in the Glassdoor Employees’ Choice Awards for 2024. As one of the fastest growing technology companies, we are disrupting the marketplace and revolutionizing the way businesses operate. Our vision is to be the leading digital challenger in Europe whilst evolving the next generation of IT consulting.

Operating across both public and private sectors, we offer a comprehensive range of services from product design and engineering, digital strategy, data services & management (Machine Learning and AI), cloud migration to program delivery and service operations, our offerings are designed to meet diverse business needs.

Job Description

Company Description

Are you ready to join the forefront of technology innovation with Netcompany?

As one of the fastest growing technology companies, we are disrupting the marketplace and revolutionizing the way businesses operate. Our vision is to be the leading digital challenger in Europe whilst evolving the next generation of IT consulting.

Operating across both public and private sectors, we offer a comprehensive range of services from application development and seamless cloud migration to program delivery and service operations, our offerings are designed to meet diverse business needs

Job Description

This is an exciting opportunity within technology consultancy, which offers you fast-track career development opportunities, as well as the opportunity to explore new and cutting-edge technologies. This role supports the full life cycle of software development, and includes the opportunity for hands-on coding. Can you see yourself playing a crucial role in supporting and driving your team to succeed? Are you looking to be involved in all parts of the process - from design and development, to ensuring that we deliver a high-quality end product to our clients?

We work with a wide range of different technologies including Python, .Net, C #, Java, Salesforce, Sharepoint, Dynamics CRM, Sitecore, ReactJS, Typescript, Angular, Docker, Azure, AzureDevOps and AWS. We always use the most suitable, and preferably the latest, technology for each project, giving you the opportunity to learn and work with many different languages.

There will always be a lead manager associated with the project with the overall delivery responsibility, who you can lean on and learn from to hone your skills around management and IT deliveries.

Must Have Experience With Python And Typescript/Javascript

Key Activities:


System development - both front-end, back-end and integrations
Workflow planning
Process optimization and quality assurance
Implementing customer requirements for the design of new features
Analysis and design of the overall solution
Daily sparring with your team
Full life cycle of delivery


Qualifications

Qualifications


+2 years experience in the IT Industry
Degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science, Information Technology or similar
A curiosity to explore new technologies
Experience across the full software development lifecycle
Ability to code within projects
Ideally a full-stack or backend technical background with experience in Python, Typescript/Javascript (react) AWS and Terraform
Previous involvement in developing and delivering major IT solutions
An understanding of agile tools and techniques
Excellent communication skills and professional attitude
Highly ambitious, wanting to excel in your career
Candidates MUST be willing to travel to client site anywhere in the UK when needed, and MUST have the right to work in the UK
Hybrid working model


Additional Information

Additional Information

Benefits:


Hybrid working model with some flexible working
25 days’ holiday
Private Medical Health care via Vitality
Pension contribution, Life Assurance
Professional certifications supported as part of learning and development.
A range of retail discounts to enhance your lifestyle, encompassing restaurants, supermarkets, travel, leisure activities and health and well-being services.
Access to our Employee Resource Groups, our groups represent diverse backgrounds and provide a platform for colleagues to connect, learn, and support one another.


Join Netcompany, where we proudly hold the 5th position on the esteemed UK Top 50 Best Places to Work in the Glassdoor Employees’ Choice Awards for 2024.

At Netcompany, we pride ourselves on our entrepreneurial spirit and our capacity for doing things differently. Our culture is built on fostering low bureaucracy, emphasizing high agility and promoting flexibility, enabling everyone to contribute their best.

Our journey began in the UK with the acquisition of Hunter Macdonald in 2017. As one of Northern Europe's most accomplished IT companies, we have expanded our headcount globally to 7400+ employees and have offices in UK, Denmark, Norway, Poland, Holland and Vietnam.

Netcompany is committed to providing an inclusive and barrier-free recruitment process for anyone wishing to apply for a job with us. We operate a Disability Confident Interview Scheme which means that we offer guaranteed interviews to all applicants with a disability who meet the minimum criteria for a role. Applicants are asked to opt in, so please let us know if you wish your application to be considered under this scheme.

If you need any reasonable adjustments or extra support during the recruitment process, please contact us at reasonableadjustments@netcompany.com.

Title: Python Developer
Description:
This is an exceptional new position for a talented Python Developer with a global Data Analytics company who have developed an independent platform which provides both management and measurement of converged TV campaigns.




This is a key position with impressive potential for growth and impact, where you will own the full development lifecycle from initial idea/design through to delivery. The person in this role will work daily with the most advanced technologies in software development, high scalability, and big data and will need exceptional Software Engineering skills.




You’ll be asked to:

• Set the technical standard for your team.

• Be a part of and own the full development lifecycle from initial idea/design through to delivery

• Work with a team of extremely talented software engineers and data scientists in a fast-paced and engaging environment

• Interact with all areas of the business, from sales to client services, to ensure the highest quality product will be delivered




You should have experience of:

• Developing complex software with end-to-end ownership

• Python or similar (Ruby or Node) or another Functional Language

• JavaScript and associated frameworks, preferably Vue, or similar

• Cloud technologies

• SQL (advantageous)

• Spark (advantageous)

• Docker/Kubernetes – advantageous )

• MongoDB, SQL, Postgres & Snowflake (advantageous)

• Developing online, cloud based SaaS products.

• Leading and building scalable architectures and distributed systems

• Working in an agile, lean software development environment




This is a pragmatic and humble organisation who are looking for like minded people to help them deliver their revolutionary technology.




In return for sharing your talent and dedication, they offer a Competitive salary, RSU’s, great benefits and annual leave together with a position of value within the organisation from day one, and the chance to have a key role in creating a product which will play a defining role in the continuously evolving converged TV sector.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
The ideal candidate's favourite words are learning, data, scale, and agility. You will leverage your strong collaboration skills and ability to extract valuable insights from highly complex data sets to ask the right questions and find the right answers.




Responsibilities

Analyze raw data: assessing quality, cleansing, and structuring for downstream processing
Design accurate and scalable prediction algorithms
Collaborate with the engineering team to bring analytical prototypes to production
Generate actionable insights for business improvements




Qualifications

Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in quantitative field (Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.)
At least 1 - 2 years of experience in quantitative analytics or data modelling
Deep understanding of predictive modelling, machine-learning, clustering and classification techniques, and algorithms
Fluency in a programming language (Python, C,C++, Java, SQL)
Familiarity with Big Data frameworks and visualization tools (Cassandra, Hadoop, Spark, Tableau)

  • Design accurate and scalable prediction algorithms
  • Collaborate with the engineering team to bring analytical prototypes to production
  • Generate actionable insights for business improvements


Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in quantitative field (Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.)
  • At least 1 - 2 years of experience in quantitative analytics or data modelling
  • Deep understanding of predictive modelling, machine-learning, clustering and classification techniques, and algorithms
  • Fluency in a programming language (Python, C,C++, Java, SQL)
  • Familiarity with Big Data frameworks and visualization tools (Cassandra, Hadoop, Spark, Tableau)

Title: Junior Data Scientist
Description:
Role: Junior Data Scientist

Location: London, UK (Hybrid)

Salary: £35k-£45k (DOE)




Are you passionate about data and finance? Join a revolutionary financial services company in the heart of London, where you'll help over 200,000 businesses across the UK and Europe navigate challenges and boost profitability.




My client is looking for a Junior Data Scientist eager to apply their analytical and modeling skills to provide insight and drive impactful business decisions.




Your Responsibilities:

Analyse complex datasets: Work with large volumes of financial data to identify trends, patterns, and insights that drive strategic decisions.
Support predictive modeling: Collaborate on the development of machine learning models to forecast financial outcomes and optimise business processes.
Develop data-driven solutions: Create algorithms and tools that automate and enhance decision-making across the company.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams: Work closely with finance, product, and technology teams to align data science initiatives with business goals.
Visualise data insights: Build and maintain interactive dashboards and visualisations that provide clear, actionable insights for stakeholders.




Requirements:

Bachelor’s degree in a STEM field: Preferred disciplines include Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, or related fields.
Proficiency in programming languages: Experience with Python and SQL for data analysis, manipulation, and modeling.
Basic understanding of machine learning: Familiarity with predictive modeling techniques and algorithms, in particular NLP, LLM's and Time Series Forecasting.
Experience with data visualization tools: Knowledge of tools like Tableau/Power BI, or similar to present data effectively.
Strong analytical skills: Ability to interpret complex data and communicate findings clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences.




It's A Bonus If You Have:

Experience in finance: Prior exposure to financial data or working in a financial services environment is a plus.
Curiosity and drive: A passion for learning and staying updated with the latest trends in data science and finance.
Problem-solving mindset: Ability to think critically and approach challenges with innovative solutions.




The Benefits:

Growth opportunities: Be part of a fast-growing company with ample opportunities for career advancement.
Innovative work environment: Work with a team that values creativity, collaboration, and continuous learning.
Cutting-edge tools and technologies: Access to the latest data science tools to help you excel in your role.
Competitive compensation: A salary that reflects your skills and experience, along with performance-based bonuses.




If you’re a motivated Junior Data Scientist with a passion for finance and data-driven decision-making, we want to hear from you. Apply now to join our team and be part of shaping the future of the finance industry.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Machine Learning Engineer

Up to £60k + equity + L&D budget

London Hybrid

Greentech




Join a growing greentech start up, focused on translating data into real world impact.




You'll work alongside the Machine Learning Lead & the CTO, focused on designing and building AI driven features/ products. This role encompasses research and POCs, through to developing production level code for resilient and high quality features.




You will focus on building and deploying AI features and products.







Role:




Develop AI products
Alongside the wider engineering team, productise models and improve performance
Support the ML Lead and CTO to expose new areas that can be improved
End to end ML, research through to production and deployment
Produce production level code
Support the ML Lead and CTO on ML architecture and product strategy







Requirements:




Experience with machine learning and modelling
Proven coding ability, able to produce production level code
AT LEAST 1+ year commercial experience in data science/ machine learning engineering
Understanding of core ML fundamentals and concepts
pandas, scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch
Some understanding of time series analysis
Strong grasp of mathematical concepts
MLOps, fullstack ML Engineering







Desirable:




Academic research (projects, publications)
Strong academic background (eg PhD), although not essential if you have the relevent commercial experience
Ideally a Physics or Engineering background (not essential)
Cloud deployment experience







Logistics:




Flexible working (most do 2-3 days per week in office)
Central London office
Up to £60k + equity
Wealth creation opportunity
L&D budget, any conference paid for
Work from anywhere opportunity several times per year




Apply now for all the details!







We are an equal opportunities employer and welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation, or age.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Machine Learning Engineer

FinTech SaaS

London – Once a week in the office

£70,000-£80,000




I’m currently working with a forward-thinking FinTech SaaS business, who are looking for a Machine Learning Engineer with experience in designing and deploying machine learning models to join their growing team in Central London.




The business has been going for 5 years and recently received series funding which they intend to invest in their AI capabilities and Data Science teams. This will help them implement AI into their SaaS product suite which is used to analyse growth opportunities and improve their clients financial services to their customers.




You will collaborate with the development team, data scientists and stakeholders to integrate machine learning solutions and gather requirements. You will have a good technical background, having worked with languages like Python and tools like Pytorch and TensorFlow.




More about the company

Founded in 2019.
Based in Central London and require office working of once a week.
FinTech SaaS Business – develop solutions to analyse growth opportunities.
Looking to implement AI/ML into their solution product suite/roadmap.
Have recently received series funding with lots of plans to grow the business.
Offers good progression opportunities to enhance skill set or lead teams in the future.




The Role – Machine Learning Engineer

Design, implement and optimize ML models for a variety of applications – incl predictive modelling, NLP, computer vision.
Good experience in Machine Learning, AI, Data Science, Engineering and SaaS – ideally 2-3 years.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify requirements.
Good technical experience with Python, Pytorch, TensorFlow, NLPs, Cloud.
Brand new role which offers great opportunities to progress in an evolving space.
Ideally have worked in SaaS environments.




Salary & Benefits

Salary: £70,000-£80,000.
8% Pension.
10% Bonus.
26 days holiday + bank holidays.
Private Medical Insurance.
Self-Development Tools & Perks.




If this role is of interest, then please apply and I can give you a call.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
We're seeking a passionate and skilled Data Scientist to join a scaling FinTech company, revolutionizing the way businesses access finance. As a key member of our Data team, you'll driving the very foundation of our company, helping to empower businesses, contributing to a more inclusive financial ecosystem. We are all about leveling up the playing field 😊👌




Why Join Us? 🎉

Make a real impact: Contribute to a mission-driven company that's empowering businesses and shaping the future of finance.
Grow your career: Join a high-growth environment with opportunities for professional development and advancement.
Enjoy a rewarding work-life balance: Competitive salary, flexible work arrangements, and a comprehensive benefits package.
Be part of a vibrant culture: Experience a dynamic and supportive work environment with team events, social clubs, and a focus on employee well-being.




Responsibilities:

Model development & implementation
Data analysis & insight generation
Model validation & monitoring
Collaboration with stakeholders




Qualifications:

Master's degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science).
3+ years of professional experience in data science.
Strong Python skills, including libraries like pandas, scikit-learn, and NumPy.
Experience with machine learning algorithms and model deployment.




Benefits:

❤️Competitive salary & benefits.
🎉 Opportunities for growth & development.
📍Flexible work arrangements - Hybrid or Remote-First




If you're interested to learn more - drop me a message! 📩

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
A leading provider of technology-driven data solutions is seeking a passionate and innovative Data Scientist to join their Core Data Function. 😊🎉




The Role 👀

This exciting and challenging role blends Data Science and Engineering to develop a groundbreaking Bespoke AI Agent. You will work at the forefront of AI, leveraging large datasets and the power of LLMs (Large Language Models) to build an intelligent and impactful agent.




The Challenge 👌:

Design, develop, and deploy AI models for the Bespoke AI Agent.
Conduct in-depth research and experimentation with various AI/ML techniques.
Collaborate closely with data engineers and software developers to build and integrate the AI Agent into production systems.
Evaluate and refine AI models based on performance metrics and user feedback.




Experience:

Propensity Modeling
Proficiency in Python with experience in libraries like Pandas, PySpark,..
Experience with large language models (LLMs) and their applications.
Strong understanding of machine learning algorithms (e.g., supervised, unsupervised, deep learning).
Familiarity with cloud platforms (ideally AWS) and cloud-based machine learning services.
3+ years of commercial experience as a Data Scientist with a strong track record of successful project delivery.




Benefits:

Competitive salary and benefits package.
Opportunities for professional development and growth.
Work on cutting-edge AI projects with a high-impact team.




If you are passionate about AI and would like to be part of a growing team, building somehting completely - drop me a message and let's discuss this in more detail 📩
