Title: Global Application Developer
Description:
Job Title: Global Applications Developer

Employment Type: Permanent

Location: Houston, Texas, US OR West Yorkshire, UK (with international travel)

Salary: £70 - £100k per annum + Benefits







About the Role

Our client is looking for a talented Global Applications Developer to join their IT team, focusing on the development, support, and optimisation of business applications used across multiple regions. This role will involve working closely with stakeholders to understand business needs, improve system functionality, and ensure seamless software performance. The ideal candidate will have strong programming expertise and a proactive approach to problem-solving.

Key Responsibilities:Develop and enhance internal applications to support business processes
Work with stakeholders to gather requirements and translate them into effective solutions
Conduct system analysis and recommend improvements to optimise performance
Oversee software testing, debugging, and deployment to ensure stability and efficiency
Provide technical support and training to end-users as required
Work collaboratively with the IT team to implement best practices and maintain system integrity

Skills & Experience:

Required:Minimum of three years' experience in software development using Java, C# (.NET), and SQL Server
Proficiency with Microsoft development tools such as Visual Studio and SQL Server Management Studio
Hands-on experience working with enterprise applications and system integration
Strong understanding of software development lifecycles and change management processes
Preferred:Exposure to CRM platforms like Salesforce or ERP solutions such as QAD or Netsuite
Experience working with BI tools (e.g., Cognos) and document management systems
Background in EDI projects or Progress SQL development
Technical Proficiency:Core Development: C#/.NET, ASP.NET Core, Java, SQL (T-SQL)
Frontend Skills: JavaScript, HTML, CSS, Angular
Additional Knowledge: XML/XSLT, PHP, API development, Web Services
Advantageous: Unix/Linux exposure, ODBC connectivity
What Our Client is Looking For:Strong analytical skills with the ability to troubleshoot and resolve issues efficiently
Excellent communication skills to engage with both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Ability to manage workloads effectively, balancing development work with system support
Organised, self-motivated, and capable of working independently or within a team

Title: AI Engineer - Mathematics Specialist PhD/Masters (Remote UK)
Description:
About the Role

We are seeking a highly skilled Mathematics Specialists who possess a PhD/Masters to join our AI team as a Prompt Engineer.

In this role, you will develop complex user prompts that incorporate pairs of mathematical skills in a non-trivial manner. Your work will contribute to cutting-edge approaches in AI data development and help illuminate the limitations of modern AI models.




Key Responsibilities

Develop intricate, domain-specific mathematical questions to probe AI model capabilities

Create content that combine multiple mathematical concepts in innovative ways. You will create and review model responses to contribute to the improvement of AI model performance in mathematical reasoning.




Project Details

Duration: January 2025 - May 2025

Work Schedule: 3-4 hours/day

Location: Remote (UK residents only)




Requirements

PhD or Master's Degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field
Strong background in advanced mathematics
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to think creatively and develop challenging mathematical scenarios
Familiarity with AI and machine learning concepts (preferred)
Strong written communication skills in English
Desktop or Laptop
Stable Internet Connection for the duration of the task




For any queries, feel free to reach out to recruitmentgenaieurope@telusinternational.com







About Us

TELUS International AI

Experience the power of TELUS International AI - where human intelligence is used to create and enhance the world's data, enabling better AI. Our global AI Community of 1 million+ annotators and linguists assists companies in testing and improving machine learning models. We offer a proprietary AI training platform that handles all data types, including text, images, audio, video, and geo, across 500+ languages and dialects. Our AI Data Solutions are designed to revolutionize AI systems in a range of applications, from advanced smart products to improved search results, expanded speech recognition, more human-like bot interactions, and beyond.







Equal Opportunity

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status. As the global arm of TELUS Corporation, at TELUS International, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of hiring are based on applicants’ qualifications, merits, competence and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

Title: Junior Reporing Analyst
Description:
Junior Reporting Analyst




Department: Business Intelligence




Reports To: BI Manager




Job Summary:




We’re seeking a Junior Reporting Analyst who’s passionate about crafting beautiful and insightful data visualizations. As a Junior Reporting Analyst, you’ll be a vital part of our BI Team, using your design skills to transform data into clear, impactful reports and dashboards that empower decision makers across the business.




Please note:

This is an onsite role - 5 days per week at our Head Office LS126DB
We are unable to offer Visa Sponsorship for this role




Key Responsibilities:




Design a creative reports and dashboards using BI Tools (Power BI).
Create visually appealing layouts and charts that effectively communicate key insights and trends.
Collaborate with other analysts and stakeholders to gather requirements and deliver exceptional reporting solutions.
Experiment with innovative data visualization techniques to improve report readability and user engagement.
Contribute to the continuous improvement of our reporting processes and standards.




What We’re Looking For:




A strong interest in data visualization and visual communication.
A creative mindset with an eye for design and aesthetics.
Basic analytical skills and an understanding of data concepts.
Some experience with BI Tools (Power BI)
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Excellent communication and problem-solving skills.
A proactive, enthusiastic and detail-oriented approach.




Alongside a salary of 23-25k we are pleased to offer the following benefits:




Simply Health – company funded, providing cashback for prescriptions, optical and dental costs 24/7 virtual GP access plus more for you and up to 4 children*
Benefits platform – discounts across multiple retailers (supermarkets, High Street etc), leisure providers, hospitality etc. Online and instore discounts
Vectis Card – instant discount card
Pension Scheme with Royal London
Personal car leases via salary sacrifice*/**
25 days holiday plus bank holidays
Holiday Flex – purchase additional holiday**
Enhanced Company Maternity, Paternity, Adoption pay, plus £200 new child payment
Flexible working patterns
Cycle to work scheme*/**
Service recognition
Training support and development opportunities
Employee Assistance Programme
Wellbeing support
Discounted gym membership
Eligible for a Blue Light Card
Subsidised BHSF Sick Pay Cover
BHSF, Life Cover, Cancer Cover, Personal Accident Cover
Free The Company Shop membership
Free Will Service
Concerts for Carers

*Benefits require completion of a 12-week probationary period before they can be accessed.

**Benefit subject to deduction not taking colleague below National Living Wage
